results.description:
Hey everyone,

We came to this spot awhile ago and had a good time so that's one reason to go back. Another reason to go back is the potential for a free beer! There is a new iOs app that is launching called "First Call" that is a subscription based service that let's you get your first drink free at specific bars. The development team reached out to beer club and it sounds like it might have appeal to some of you beer lovers out there.

In the next day or two, I'll post another message about how to download the app, what the details are and how to get a week for free (it's usually $10 per week). I also want to note that I am not an investor in the app, I'm not getting any kickbacks or anything for sharing it with the group and I'm not endorsing it one way or the other. Just having discussions with the First Call development team, I thought it sounded interesting and knew that it would be a really great app for some people and it doesn't cost anything to try it out.

So look for the message about how to download the app on your iPhone (sorry Android people, like me) later this week. But even if you're not interested in the app, come to the meetup!

Let me know if you have any questions.
Cheers!
Bill
results.how_to_find_us: Go to the back of the bar
results.name: Let's drink beer in the East Village!

results.description:
Actors, writers and filmmakers are developing their own shows to control the filmmaking process and call the shots. 

Who is this for?

Any creator who wants to learn how to create their own web series, film or documentary. Any genre and skill level. Every month members get together for a pitch meeting. Pitches for films or web series are made, crews are formed and the filmmaking process starts.

This is an information session on how this process can help you get your film made. Also great for those who want to learn filmmaking. It is a simple process. Any member can pitch a film or web series idea that they need help on. In three minutes they express the idea, describe the crew positions they need and get people interested in their project.

Once all the pitches are heard you will have time to mingle with others and talk to the owner about working about their project.

After the information session we will have a pitch meeting for members.
results.name: LEARN HOW a MAKE and OWN YOUR FILM (Writers, Actors, Filmmakers)

group.name: LIGHT & SHADOW: A Film & Video Lighting Workshop

results.description:
We're working with Above the Law for this upcoming free event. The Securities and Exchange Commission recently voted 3-2 to propose new rules requiring that public companies “clawback” the incentive pay of executives if a company’s financial statements are later found to contain errors, expanding existing clawback scenarios to apply more broadly to restatements, including those issued because of mistakes. Above the Law and Wolters Kluwer is hosting a panel discussion on these issues with distinguished guests, including a former SEC general counsel Ralph Ferrara of Proskauer, and Marc Powers of Baker Hostetler. 

Event is free, and includes 1 hour CLE credit.


YOU MUST RSVP HERE AND ON THE EVENT PAGE: http://info.abovethelaw.com/clawbacks-panel-discussion
results.how_to_find_us: PLEASE RSVP USING LINK BELOW AS WELL.
results.name: Above the Law Panel Discussion - Is the New Clawbacks Rule a Mistake?

results.description:
November 11, we are partnering with our friends Hardware Hack Lab at ThoughtWorks! Here is their blurb:


Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

NeuroTechNYC is the NYC chapter of NeuroTechX, an international organization of designers, engineers, neuroscientists, hackers, and more. 

Join us on November 11 for a night of neurohacking! We'll be working on a new project, OpenEXP, for running experiments with EEG, discussing potential projects to pursue on an ongoing basis, and getting down and dirty with some hardware, code, and bio-signals. There will be EMG-powered robotic arms and brain waves galore. :D

We have a number of EEG and human-computer interface devices, including a bunch of OpenBCI boards, an Emotiv Insight, a few NeuroSky headsets, and a lots of other biosensors.

If you have your own neurotech devices, please bring them! Otherwise just bring your brain and the desire to create and collaborate!
results.name: NeuroTechNYC Hack Night #4

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Spiritual Laws That Govern Humanity and the Universe by Lonnie C. Edwards, M.D.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 6: The Essence of the Rosicrucian Teachings.

You can download the e-book FREE here!

About the Book

God has created laws by which the universe is governed. Humanity has continued to set these laws into creative motion through thoughts, prayers, motives, intentions, voices, and beliefs. These are the right tools. In this book the student will learn how to use them always for the good.

Human beings are responsible for creating the good, the beautiful, and the true-all of which we desire to experience. But humans are also responsible for creating that which we do not desire to experience. However, being co-creators with God, the quality of our thoughts, beliefs, and intentions will determine and manifest our world. There is work to do, and those who are on the path with knowledge of God’s attributes and God’s laws, and with love and good will in their hearts, will do that work. This is your guide to put these concepts into practice in our troubled world today!

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Spiritual Laws: Rosicrucian Teachings

Join us for Scrabble every Wednesday.  The first people usually arrive between 5:00 and 5:30, and the last people leave around 10:00.  Come any time.

We tend to play two-person games.  It's a friendly, low-key game with a range of skill levels.  Whatever people agree on in terms of dictionaries, challenges, and anything else is fine.  The main objective is to have fun.

Panera in Wayne is on Route 23 southbound, in the Brentwood Plaza (second driveway south of Ratzer Road).

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 5 spots for this meetup.

Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 5 people signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 5 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. I do sign ups this way so everyone has a chance to attend events. I know I tend to post things late at night and want morning people to also get to come to events.

The Place: Navy is a 41-seat cozy neighborhood restaurant on a tree-lined street in Soho. Created by Matt Abramcyk and Akiva Elstein, partners in Smith & Mills. Chef Camille Becerra focuses on seafood and vegetables, working closely with the Lancaster Farm Fresh Co-op to source her produce. A raw bar offers fresh oysters, clams and sea urchin for uni toast along with blinis and house-cured fish and caviar; seedy crackers and primo sardines. Market fresh seasonal menu is subject to change on a weekly and daily basis.

Sample Menu: http://navynyc.com/uploaded_files/dinner.pdf

RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Navy - Seafood

results.description:
Let's try Uzbeki food for a change. Think meat salads, vegetable salads, soups, dumplings, kebabs, potatoes, and fish, eaten family style. I'll choose a variety of dishes, with input from attendees, and the food bill will be split evenly. Estimate $26-30 per person with tax, tip, and $3 fee.


Some likely choices:

Lagman soup (lamb, noodles, vegetables, broth)


Tashkent (cold tongue salad)

Avocado salad

Morkovcha (carrot & cumin salad)

Nowruz salad (like Greek salad, w/a sour cream dressing)


Babaganoush

Skirt steak salad


Herring or smoked mackerel with potatoes

Fish platter appetizer (lox, butterfish, smoked mackerel)


Homestyle potatoes w/garlic & herbs or w/mushrooms


Pumpkin samsa (turnovers)


Lamb manti (dumplings)


Plov (rice with lamb, chickpeas, carrots)


Assorted meat kebabs

Kurutob (bread & greens with yogurt)

Fatir (layered bread)

Full menu is at: http://whereyoueat.com/Dushanbe-Cafe--9293.html

I've never been to Cafe Dushanbe, but it replaced the well-liked Cafe Rokhat with a similar menu in the same space, and also has good Yelp reviews: http://www.yelp.com/biz/cafe-dushanbe-brooklyn

Closest subway is the Q or B to Sheepshead Bay.

Who's in?

results.description:
Hey New York eCommerce / Magento Meetup Fans,

Want to know how to get the most out of your storefront? Brian Eilber, Cloud Solution Architect at INetU, will share with us the importance of having a honed infrastructure to power your Magento site. 

More About Brian Eilber:

Brian Eilber, a Cloud Solutions Architect at INetU, has been in the IT industry for more than a decade, working with cloud systems, administering Magneto systems, and architecting environments. Prior to this role, Brian worked in the system engineering and administration departments. When not working on servers, Brian likes to spend time with his family and tinkering on other technical pet projects and also hanging out with the VP of customer experience and engagement from Red Hat.


More About INetU:

INetU customers are able to reduce costs, improve application performance, increase security and compliance all while offering the flexibility they need to respond rapidly to business and IT needs.  

They provide solutions for private clouds, public clouds, Amazon Web Services, dedicated servers and hybrid cloud environments. Their team will ensure that the services you receive match the needs of your business both today and as it continues to grow.

https://www.inetu.net/


The agenda for this event:

7:00 pm - Networking 

7:30 pm - 30 second elevator pitch of what you do or something you're working on

7:45 pm - Brian Eilber will be presenting 

8:15 pm - Q&A followed by Pizza and Networking 

Please message me directly if you're interested in presenting at this meetup, or any other meetups in the future.

See you soon! 

This meetup is presented by Hara Partners

results.name: New York eCommerce Meetup: “Optimizing the infrastructure for Magento Apps”

results.description:
Hello again Players,

We have three really cool new companies that want you to test out some new tech this month and room for one more. One pair of bluetooth headphones with advanced audio recording capabilities. And one web app that lets you post public comments anonymously.

As always, we'll bring the pizza and beverages and you bring your laptop, smartphone, and/or tablet to test out apps. Or you can look on with someone else.

The less you know about the companies and their products before you come the better. It makes for a better back-and-forth discussion with the founders when you can share your initial visceral and emotional reactions in real time. But here is just a bit of information on each so you know what you're in for.

@MakeTimeClock

Get serious about your passion project by tracking your progress.

confesh.com

Confesh is a neutral space to help private communities discuss sensitive topics. They don't care about or store any information about you so you can post anonymously. Oh, you're going to have so many questions about this, it'll be great.

@GetCroissant


A seamless way to bounce around different NYC workspaces at an affordable price.


See you there!
results.name: Let's meet up and play with new tech

results.description:
Are you thinking about buying real estate in New York City or the surrounding suburbs and need some answers to the myriad of questions that such a project can pose? If the answer is yes, then don't miss this CityKinder Seminar in cooperation with experienced brokers Nataly Rothschild & Julie Zelman with Engel & Voelkers and Sandra Goldstein with Julia B Fee | Sotheby’s International Realty. 

There are many factors to consider when you decide to go from renting to buying and weighing city versus suburb living. This free seminar is led by 2 established real estate brokers representing Manhattan and Westchester are answering questions like:

• What am I buying? - Differences between Condo, Co-op or Townhouse

• Why do I need a broker and how does he/she get paid

• Who do I need on my team? - Broker, mortgage broker, inspectors, lawyers…

• General timeline for buying a home

• Pros and cons between city and suburb living

• Taxes, savings, hidden costs

• School systems & zoning

• Commuting options and costs

This free seminar is especially geared towards international buyers who have to adhere to some additional rules and regulations during the process. A mortgage broker will also be present to answer questions about requirements and qualifications.

Join us for wine and snacks after the presentation and a chance to meet our speakers and presenters. 

This seminar is held in English. Individual Q&A can be in German after the event. 

REGISTER HERE - FREE SEMINAR

Thank you to our Sponsors:
results.name: FREE SEMINAR: Buying Real Estate for Internationals

results.description:
COME CHECK OUT THE FIRST DAY OF THIS FIVE WEEK WORKSHOP FOR ONLY $5 BUCKS!

Meditative Writing with Jessica Hinds

“It took me four years to paint like Raphael, but a lifetime to paint like a child.” – Pablo Picasso

There was a time when creativity was easy—when you were a child, driven by an endless desire to create, and no fear, no judgment, and no internal censor whatsoever.

The goal of meditative writing is to return you to that time, when finding your voice as a writer was as easy as being yourself, and raw creativity flowed as effortlessly as inspiration.

You’ll learn to banish writer’s block forever, find inspiration in an instant, and discover the heart of your story and your characters, by tapping into your own voice as a writer, and your deepest creative instincts.

How Does It Work?

Each session begins with a short guided meditation, followed by a series of carefully crafted meditative writing exercises, designed to transport you out of your everyday life, and connect you to the emotional truth of your story and of your characters.

Over 5 weeks, you’ll build a writing practice that allows you to get your pages flowing at will, recover the joy you’ve always felt with writing, and write from your most connected place every time you sit down with your characters.

Meetup Members can check out the first session for only $5 bucks with no obligation, to decide if the class is right for you!

Who Should Take Meditative Writing?


Whether you are brand new to writing, or a seasoned writer looking to inject energy back into your writing, meditative writing will change your writing life forever.

Designed for writers of all types, including screenwriters, playwrights, poets, novelists, and writers of any other genre, here are just a few of the many benefits of this approach:

Uncovering the Real Emotional Underbelly That Drives Great Films

Discovering Your True Voice

Creating More Provocative Dialogue, Images and Action

Developing an “Inspiration on Command” Writing Schedule

Injecting Joy Into Your Writing Process

Getting in Touch With Your Characters

Finding the Heart of Your Story

Discovering Theme

Natural Subtext

Opening Up Your Creative Side

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, November 11th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The November session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (October 28th - November 18th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (October 28th - November 18th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (October 27th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue

results.description:
Description: 


So often you hear that without the proper culture and executive buy in you can’t implement Lean. Isn’t it depressing if you don’t happen to have that available and instead work at a bank or something?   

Maybe as a cog in the wheel we can't turn our company into the next Toyota, but if we are participating in a team or part of a project we can setup fundamentals which can start leading us towards the path of small continuous improvements. We will be reviewing practical changes that can help your team get better bit by bit.

Presenter: Neil Smith works at Credit Suisse as the enhancement stream manager for the Credit Desk, he has been in IT for over 25 years and can’t seem to escape it.


Location: Spotify is on 45 W. 18th Street. That's between 6th and 5th avenues, above the Bed Bath and Beyond. They're up on the 7th floor.
results.how_to_find_us: Between 6th and 5th avenues, above the Bed Bath and Beyond. Spotify is up on the 7th floor.
results.name: The Softest Bullet – “Implementing Lean Learnings in an Enterprise Setting"

results.description:
How can thousands of people work together, at the same time, on the same problem? Matthew Weber will share his technique to atomize a big strategic problem into thousands of smaller components, send them out to any number of individual workers, and then have the parts magically reassemble into a large, cohesive, well-thought out and easy to read strategic document, within a matter of hours.

Come see this talk on November 11th at the UX + Data Meetup, and then come to the UX Awards conference on November 16th where Matthew will present the second half of the story - the four golden rules to scale human insight with big data.

Matthew Weber is VP of UX at Zoomdata, teaches UX Portfolio at NYU, and is the organizer of the UX + Data Meetup.
results.name: Massively Collaborative Problem Solving

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

results.description:
Interested in real estate investing but do not know where to begin?  Are you a seasoned investor who wants to make things happen?  Want to learn more and network with like minded individuals looking to tackle the market by storm?  Come on out to O'Malley's Restaurant and Bar in Nyack, NY on Wednesday November 11th at 7PM! 

This month, Tracy Mooney & Jessica Hennig from Basement Systems of New York and Dr. Energy Saver of Hudson Valley will be ready to answer all of to assess basements of investment properties with a fine tooth comb and have the upper hand when making offers.  Bring your notebook and take notes during this great presentation!

"Quality Home Comfort That Lasts A Lifetime."  That's the philosophy at Basement Systems of New York and Dr. Energy Saver of Hudson Valley. These two partner companies, part of a family of four companies, are working to create a safe, clean, and comfortable environment for every home and family. Basement Systems of New York has been taking care of "All Things Basementy" for over 20 years. They have a tremendous line of services which include: Waterproofing, Foundation and Crawlspace Repair, Humidity Control, Basement and Crawlspace Insulation, Concrete Leveling, Radon Mitigation, and a yearly maintenance Care Package for sump pumps. 

Dr. Energy Saver of Hudson Valley is also making great strides towards improving the quality of life at home by offering extensive home energy evaluations and industry-leading insulation services, such as spray foam insulation. By educating homeowners on the unique issues of their home, their staff, specialists, and installation technicians want to provide the best solutions to fit every home's need. Their local roots, nation-wide industry connections, and extensive training allow them to set the standard for bringing custom, quality, and affordable home comfort to our area.

Keep sending those leads, A & C Home Buyers is searching for their next flip!  

As always, this event is free.  Please consider enjoying some delicious food/drinks and enjoy the free cookies provided by Aunt Mia's Sweets.  See you then!
results.name: Come to O'Malley'­­s Bar and Restaurant in Nyack, NY on Wed.  Nov. 11th at 7PM!

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 7-9:30pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.how_to_find_us: 39th street between 7th and 8th ave (closer to 8th ave).  Go to 257 West 39th street, and take the elevator to the 14th floor.  And look at the white board for "Steve"

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Our Help Often crew had a great time at Masbia Rego Park in October, so we're going to make a habit of it!

But wait, what's Masbia?

Masbia is a Kosher soup kitchen that feeds everyone who’s hungry. They are present in Boro Park, Flatbush, Williamsburg and Rego Park, Queens, and they could use a hand. Here’s a bit more about the Rego Park center, where we intend to help out first: 

"Known as the "free restaurant," Masbia serves a three-course meal five nights a week in a restaurant-like setting that offers its patrons the privacy and dignity that everyone deserves. But every day, the challenge of feeding the needy continues to grow. The more Masbia feeds, the more it depends on generous people in the community to keep its doors open. 

The Rego Park soup kitchen operates in a storefront on a commercial strip on Queens Blvd. and was beautifully renovated, with moldings, drapery to protect people's privacy, and adorned with paintings of shtetl life by a Jerusalem artist. The renovation includes Jerusalem stone paneling, which gives the space an extra special touch. The decor of the place makes you feel like you've entered a high-end New York restaurant. A foyer in the front was built as a waiting room so that people don't have to stand in a "bread line" outside."

Our mission, should we choose to accept it (and we do!) is as follows:

"We have a weekly pantry program where we distribute grocery bags to hundreds of families in need who come from all over the city. This takes place on Thursday morning through the afternoon. We do much of our preparation for this large weekly project on Wednesday nights at our kitchen in Rego Park, Queens. Tasks include bagging produce, organizing and setting up our pantry, and other simi

lar tasks. We could set up such a project for Wednesday October 21st at our Rego Park site from 7:00pm until 9:00pm, and it would make a big impact on our level of preparedness for pantry day."

Let’s do it!

RSVP if you have a fairly high degree of certainty you can be there to lend a hand for a very worthy cause. It’ll be a great opportunity to hang out with fellow assemblers and other volunteers, and most of all, to HELP OFTEN.
results.name: HELP OFTEN - Masbia Rego Queens - November 2015

results.description: Come to our purely positive séance where we encourage mystics, psychics, mediums and all people to enhance their spiritual awareness in a safe and empowering environment. All of our séance conductors are highly trained and renowned mediums. Whether you are looking to connect with a loved one who has recently passed or to receive messages from spirit, our group offers a warm and friendly environment to all who are interested. Before each séance we begin our group with a 15 minute lesson on psychic development, covering topics from psychic impressions to spirit communication. We then begin our séance with a nondenominational prayer of protection and lead a guided visual mediation. After the meditation each person who attends will receive a message from one of our highly trained séance conductors. All participants are guaranteed to receive a message. Our group meets for approximately 2 hours. The purpose of our séance is to communicate directly with spirit and to form an open and inviting spiritual community in New York City Our meeting times are every other Wednesday Night at 7:00pm and our fee is $20. Please be timely, because we do not open our doors once we begin our meditation (for obvious reasons :). For legal purposes it is understood that our group and the messages given at our séances are for entertainment purposes only.
results.name: Seance in The City Meetup

results.description:
Join in as we gather Together to begin The Journey of Your Life!  

With the Age old idiom, "As Above, so below"..... to "know others is knowledge, but to Know One's Self, is Wisdom."  This journey of a thousand miles begins with One Step....Know Thyself.  And to do so.... we are All given  the answers we need simply hidden within in our Birth Date.

Through the process of the Ancient Arts of Metaphysics, we can begin to learn and rediscover the Archetype of who we really are and harness that True Power of Our Self.  With this Power we can begin to understand the inner working of our Psyche and unify our Higher Self to our physical Being.

The light and friendly discussions will revolve around our experiences in Spirituality and the Forces of Nature at work within our own Being. From the Cycles of the Stars to the daily routines of our Lives, we will learn to work our Vibration to be concurrent with what is happening around Us, optimizing the outcome of "fate" and creating our own Destiny.

Die hard cinephiles, academic film enthusiasts, and casual movie goers looking to expand their movie going experience welcome. Cerebral Cinema is a group geared toward getting together to watch a variety of eclectic cinema ranging from highbrow indie fare to genre blockbusters and gathering to discuss such films thereafter. Guests of the group are expected to purchase their own tickets, available online as well as at the box office, however exceptions can be made for students and newcomers to the group (enquire with the event organizer).

Directed by Tom McCarthy (The Station Agent, Win Win), Spotlight showcases the true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the horrid scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the Massachusetts Catholic Archdiocese, forever skewing societies view of the church. Considered by some to be a modern day All the President's Men, Spotlight's all-star cast includes Mark Ruffalo, Rachel McAdams, Brian d'Arcy James, Michael Keaton, Stanley Tucci, Liev Schreiber, and Billy Crudup.

results.description:
Tristan Harris, Product Philosopher from Google will be in town next week and hosting this meetup on Empowering Design. We'd like to keep it to an intimate group of UX Designers, Product Leads, and Company Leaders so please RSVP..

--

As designers, when we make choices about screens, we put users into invisible frames. These frames structure the way people see their lives, their choices, their time, and their roles. For example, Email often puts users into a frame of "Plowing Through It", in which they see their life as a list of tasks to tick off. But this may not be the most empowering way for that person to see their reality. What would be?

In this workshop, we'll play games and redesign screens to understand how to put people into empowering frames that empower people to navigate how they want to spend time (and their life) according to their values.

--

Time Well Spent (http://timewellspent.io) is a growing movement of designers, product managers, metrics people, and founders who've grown disenchanted with the Attention Economy, and the need to measure success in terms of transactions – clicks, sales, active users, engagement – and instead want to measure success in terms of net positive contributions to people's lives.

Just like a city shapes the lives of its inhabitants, software shapes the lives of its users. Therefore software design, like urban planning, is a domain of great responsibility. Sometimes what's good for business isn't the same as what's good for people. As designers, it's often hard to navigate these situations or see them clearly. That's why we gather, to understand and support each other in how to design products and screens that help people spend their time, and their lives, well.
results.name: "Seeing the Matrix" – Workshop on Designing 'Empowering' Screens

group.name: Design for Time Well Spent - NYC

Explore electronics, coding, and creative technology at our monthly Micro-controller night. We talk about Arduinos, Raspberry Pis, and the other tiny devices we love to use for embedded projects. A laptop with a usb port is recommended in case you want to get hands on with any of the devices.

This event is free for everyone. Please bring a computer with a USB port, ideally bring one or more micro-controllers that you want to work with, or at least a project idea. Please share your ideas in the comments below to inspire others.

Boards are available online, or PM the organizer and they can either get one for you or tell you where they're cheapest online.

MakerBar volunteers will be present to help you with your electronics project or work on their own.

You're welcome to come hack on whatever you'd like, even if it's totally unrelated to electronics entirely. There will be plenty of awesome hackers from our community for you to meet.

The Microcontroller Special Interest Group runs on the second Wednesday every month.


[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

AMC Empire 25 (W 42nd, btw 7th and 8th Av.)

New York Daily News and Access Hollywood attending. Celebration after.

The true story of a journalist
Crazy enough to think
She could change the world.


Come out, share and support Nellie Bly who changed NYC and the world, saved thousands of lives and improved the treatment of mentally ill and poor women forever.


"I really liked it and encourage everyone, all women, to see it." ~ Rosie O'Donnell


Bly is an inspiring, trailblazer female American role model. The film is a faithful adaptation of Bly's book with Brooke Kroeger, author of "Nellie Bly: Daredevil, Reporter, Feminist" and world's expert on Nellie Bly as consultant on the film. Hollywood insiders say Caroline Barry deserves the Oscar for her magnificent performance as Nellie Bly.


“Energy rightly applied and directed will accomplish anything.”  ~ Nellie Bly

results.description:
Let's turn our sights on the good ol'fashioned American frontier. Where a 14 year old Tenesseean crosses paths with a group of unruly bandits on a mission to murder, steal, and pillage the open frontier.  

// Book
Blood Meridian, Cormac McCarthy 
An epic novel of the violence and depravity that attended America's westward expansion, Blood Meridian brilliantly subverts the conventions of the Western novel and the mythology of the "wild west." Based on historical events that took place on the Texas-Mexico border in the 1850s, it traces the fortunes of the Kid, a fourteen-year-old Tennesseean who stumbles into the nightmarish world where Indians are being murdered and the market for their scalps is thriving.

Trigger warning: According to reviews, this book is pretty brutal to intentionally subvert the mythos of the western hero. Topics include: rape and intense violence. 

// Location
Sons of Essex, 133 Essex St
Reminiscent of the boy gangs of old New York and the old American dream, this cozy speakeasy-esque eatery is a cultural staple for the Lower East Side. 

// Dues
This book club does not require annual membership dues. However, we kindly ask that attendees bring $2 cash to the event to cover Meetup fees and the occasional book giveaway!


// Book Giveaway
Book giveaway will be announced closer to Meetup date.


// Next Month
Next month's theme will be HISTORICAL FICTION. To vote for next month's book, click here.

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
Are you thinking about buying real estate in New York City or the surrounding suburbs and need some answers to the myriad of questions that such a project can pose? If the answer is yes, then don't miss this CityKinder Seminar in cooperation with experienced brokers Nataly Rothschild & Julie Zelman with Engel & Voelkers and Sandra Goldstein with Julia B Fee | Sotheby’s International Realty. 

There are many factors to consider when you decide to go from renting to buying and weighing city versus suburb living. This free seminar is led by 2 established real estate brokers representing Manhattan and Westchester are answering questions like:

• What am I buying? - Differences between Condo, Co-op or Townhouse

• Why do I need a broker and how does he/she get paid

• Who do I need on my team? - Broker, mortgage broker, inspectors, lawyers…

• General timeline for buying a home

• Pros and cons between city and suburb living

• Taxes, savings, hidden costs

• School systems & zoning

• Commuting options and costs

This seminar is especially geared towards international buyers who have to adhere to some additional rules and regulations during the process. 

A mortgage broker will also be present to answer questions about requirements and qualifications. Join us for wine and snacks after the presentation and a chance to meet our speakers and presenters. 

This seminar is held in English. 

Individual Q&A can be in German after the event. 

REGISTER HERE

Thank you to our Sponsors:

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

results.description:
Be aware: There is no entry system at Mark's apartment, so knock on the door or a window to the left of the door, and if no one answers, call[masked]-3368.

This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending. Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group. Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday, eleven days prior to the Meetup. On that day, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order, with a link to the Google Drive folder where the stories live. That list will also appear under Discussions and will be edited as changes occur.

To submit, Email your submission to [masked]

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam

MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.

Send to [masked]

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!

results.description:
Let's play Crokinole on Wednesday nights!


Don't know Crokinole? It's like a table-top version of curling, shuffleboard, darts and billiards. If you like just one of these games, you'll probably dig Crokinole.

To learn more about this traditional Canadian game (circa 1860) and about our specific weekly sessions at Milk and Roses, then read the papers!


We've been in a few rags lately, and the best-written article is this one... from the Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2015/07/26/crokinole-gains-a-following-in-brooklyn-thanks-to-canadian-expat.html

Same place as usual: Milk and Roses (1110 Manhattan Ave in Greenpoint, between Dupont and Clay).

Same time as usual: 7:30pm 'till close.

Please RSVP if you'd like to join in! If I know how many people are coming, then I can be sure to have enough boards present and polished for plenty of playing time for all :)

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

Experience a Spiritual Tool
That Can Help Transform Your Life!

 

No matter what your spiritual background or faith, you are invited to learn a simple technique that can help transform your life. Join us and others in your community to experience spiritual insights gained by singing HU—a love song to God.

Singing HU can:
• Expand your awareness
• Help you release mental and emotional stresses
• Heal a broken heart
• Offer solace during times of grief
• Help you experience divine love


We sing HU together for about 20 minutes followed by five minutes of quiet contemplation. Light refreshment and conversation follow. Please join us—your friends and family are invited, too. We hope to see you there.

Every Second Wednesday,  7:30 – 8:30 pm

There is on-street parking and two municipal parking lots in the area. Please pay particular attention to meters and parking signs. (Metered parking is free evenings after 7pm and on Sundays.)

results.description:
Empowering The Masculine - An Open Meeting of The Brotherhood

Wednesday, November 11th, 2015, 7:30pm-9:30p, promptly. How can we men awaken to a more empowered masculine presence? Where is our edge and how do we find the strength and support to live a life of action and accountability in alignment with our deepest purpose? This is an invitation for all men who wish to explore their masculinity through empowering challenges and inspiring feedback in a supportive group environment. The Brotherhood, a tribe of men who gather every week, will be leading this open Men's Workshop on Wednesday, November 11th at 7:30pm. We will be collecting $10 per participant.

It's our Mission to create a safe and sacred space to allow our Brothers to take off their armor, put down their shields, and open themselves to the strength and beauty of challenging interactions and exercises with other men, as well as giving and receiving supportive feedback within a group dynamic. This gathering is an introduction to Men’s Work open to both newcomers and experienced men who would like to connect with other conscious men. Bring a friend, a co-worker, a brother -- you know who they are!
Come celebrate with other men who are committed to living their deepest truth and offering their greatest gifts.

ADDITIONAL INFO:

What is the Brotherhood? 
We are men of action who challenge and support each other to live free and authentic lives. Five Reasons For A Man To Join a Men's Group: 
Paraphrased from David Deida’s "The Way of the Superior Man”

1) BE IN THE COMPANY OF OTHER MEN - A man discovers and fine-tunes his purpose in solitude, in challenging situations, and in the company of other men who won't settle for his bullshit. A man’s capacity to receive another mans direct criticism is a measure of his capacity to receive masculine energy.

2) HAVE MEN HOLD YOU ACCOUNTABLE FOR LIVING YOUR DEEPEST PURPOSE - Your mission is your priority. Unless you know your mission and have aligned your life to it, your core will feel empty. Your presence in the world will be weakened, as will your presence with your intimate partner.

3) FIND MEN WHO ARE AS DEDICATED AS YOU ARE - Be in the company of other men who have dedicated their lives to integrity, truth, and the heart. Your dedication will inspire each other to live with an open heart and give your deepest gifts of love, mission and presence.

4) SUPPORT YOUR EDGE WITH OTHER MEN - Choose male friends who themselves are living at their edge, facing their fears and living just beyond them. Men of this kind can empower you to confront the necessary realities that your life involves.

5) CUT THROUGH YOUR BS - At least once a week, get together with your men friends to serve one another. Cut through the bullshit and talk with each other straight. Welcome such criticisms from your friends. Suggest challenges for each other to take on in order to bring each other through limiting fears.

Location: Chelsea Studios: 151 West 26th Street New York, NY 
When: November 11th,[masked]:30-9:30pm 
Please be punctual, late arrivals will be turned away. Space is limited. Exchange: $10 to cover the cost of space rental
results.name: Empowering The Masculine - An Open Meeting of The Brotherhood

Vocalist Shoshana Bush grew up in Los Angeles singing American standards and loving Ella and Louis. After graduating from Columbia University with a degree in jazz studies and working with George Lewis, Christine Correa and Barry Harris, she returned to LA and spent two years gigging and expanding her repertoire. 

She has commanded the stage of New York's Birdland Jazz Club four times (her NYC home-base), culminating with a performance on December 12th celebrating her spring album release. Shoshana proudly opened up for Jane Monheit during Monheit's week-long performance at New York's esteemed Blue Note Jazz Club. 

Shoshana's Live at Catalina album, and subsequent performances at Blue Note and Birdland are new milestones for this young Jazz and Blues singer on the rise. "Shoshana is a developing artist with a bright future as a jazz singer," Les Traub, Cabaret Scenes.

results.description:
20Something is the largest social events organization for young lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender people in New York City, aged 21 to 30. 

We hold a monthly social, and two monthly icebreaker/discussion groups at the Brooklyn Pride Center and at the Bureau of General Services—Queer Division, the queer cultural center and bookstore on the second floor of The LGBT Community Center, in Manhattan. 

With more than 2,500 members, we engage young adults across all 5 boroughs with a safe, confidential, and respectful platform to meet other LGBT folk. Many of our members have made long lasting friendships, relationships, and have been connected to important LGBT services and resources. 

Whether you are new to the city, recently out, or just looking to make friends – 20Something offers a space for you to pave the way to your own adventures in New York City – and make living here a little easier. 

$5 suggested donation. Refreshments will be provided. Bring friends!
results.name: Second Wednesdays at the Manhattan LGBT Center

results.description:
11:11 New Moon Healing Sanctuary & Twin Flame Activation by Special Guests Pedro & Chela Rosas

All are welcome to come Wednesday Nov 11th for an exciting evening of healing & illumination!


Let us warmly welcome Sacred Soul Union, the joint endeavor of Pedro & Chela Rosas. They embody the Twin Flame frequency* & extend their healership in service to all. On this blessed evening of 11-11 we will experience their gifts of soul activation and expansion, allowing ourselves to feel more self-love and thus space for loving others. 11-11 is a powerful day for opening the gate to expand current relationships that serve the highest good of all, to manifest new relationships, and most importantly, to feel a deeper connection to the divine within you!

This event is open to all- those who are single or in a relationship.

*Please read below to learn more about the power of the Twin Flame.

The program will include:
• Opening Ceremony
• Healing Shamanic Drum Journeying
• Twin Flame Activation and Meditation by Pedro & Chela Rosas
• Satvic music
• Heart Opening Vegan Chocolate
• Community LOVE & more!

When: Wednesday November 11th 2015

Time: 8-10:00 pm

*Please be respectful and arrive on time as we will open ceremony promptly.

Where: Jeanette Stoner Studio
83 Leonard Street 5th Floor
Tribeca NYC

Cost: $25 or two for $40 if one brings a friend.

RSVP for one: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2YC8XWYVCQJXQ

RSVP for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=UXF88JWC2AFFW

What is the Twin Flame frequency?
“Love for self, for the actualization of our whole selves, and Love in a romantic relationship with sacred intentions of mirroring and fulfillment: what we call a Sacred Partnership. Whether you are in a relationship, or in between, this evening will allow your soul to grow and expand into its true desire for higher harmony and creative purpose in relationship.

Guests Chela and Pedro of Sacred Soul Union embody the Twin Flame frequency, an evolutionary resonance uniting and balancing the divine masculine and feminine frequencies. The Twin Flame union pertains to all relationships in the spectrum of sexual orientation. They extend their joint healership as an offering to foster balance in this time of great, accelerated transformation.

Many Twin Flame couples are reuniting at this time, which beyond the personal is helping to heal the planet. This is by balancing distortions in gender that have caused suffering for so long on the planet, allowing a new type of leadership to emerge balanced in qualities of the divine feminine.

Being in relationship has a way of mirroring our full selves, the light and shadow, and can bring forth challenging aspects of ourselves that were previously unrecognized to be acknowledged, accepted, healed and transmuted. Paradoxically, it is also a way of experiencing in this earthly dimension the immense joy and bliss of how we are loved by spirit. The frequencies from this gathering intend to facilitate navigating these two aspects.

In order to manifest anything, we must first resonate at its' frequency. In this quantum leap space between "what is" and "what is possible" as it pertains to a sacred relationship, it is our intention that our offerings can assist to others so that the partner and relationship shows up with ease. This also applies to taking an existing relationship to a next level, or doing personal healing work as it relates to oneself.

Pedro and Chela have extended this work for the past two years to hundreds of recipients, and recently celebrated their wedding June of 2014. Their work is a testament to the power of love, harmony and acceptance in relationship. They have assisted many individuals in manifesting a partnership after a Twin Flame Activation, or deepening into new levels of intimacy and harmony with their current partner. Some have even met their beloved at a Twin Flame Activation event!” –Pedro and Chela Rosas


About Sacred Soul Union, Chela and Pedro:
Sacred Soul Union is the joint endeavor of healers Chela and Pedro Rosas. Together Chela and Pedro embody the “Twin Flame” frequency and commit their work together in healing service to the planet, to bring the sacred masculine and feminine into balance (as they relate to all spectrums of sexual orientation) and to assist others in finding fulfillment in sacred partnership.

Pedro De Las Rosas is divine channel, medium, shamanic healer and reverend. Born in Venezuela, he was initiated in Curanderismo at the age of 16. The culmination of his healership incorporates his practice of healing arts, shamanism, Buddhism and sound healing. Pedro feels a deep connection to his ancestry and has been actively guided by his great-grandmother, who was a renowned healer in Chile during the 20th century. Pedro is a ceremonial leader and is in service to the community through shamanic healing ceremonies and sweat lodges. He is guided by native traditions from the Amazon and other lineages. Pedro is also a celebrated documentary photographer, a skill that he employs to bring truth, justice and harmony to the planet.

Lauren "Chela" Harkrader Rosas is a Brennan Healing Science Practitioner, Reiki Master, doula and Reverend in the Oder of Melchizedek. She is a certified sound healer trained by Tom Kenyon and has also studied under Drunvalo Melchizedek. Chela is also a world traveled DJ; a singer/songwriter, fashion stylist, artist and performer. She weaves together many forms of artistic expression, incorporating prayer, activism, and sacred knowledge. Her early years were filled with expansive consciousness, raised as a Unitarian Universalist, spending years living in Nicaragua, and learning Reiki at 17 years old. She graduated Oberlin College with High Honors in Studio Art. Through her experience in healing transformation and overcoming many health challenges, she has awakened to know her own nature as divine bliss, which guides and informs her in assisting her clients. With compassion and presence that is gentle, playful and fierce, Chela believes we each possess the tools and guidance we need to become our own best healer and teacher.
https://www.facebook.com/SacredSoulUnion/?pnref=about.overview

Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you. www.sarahevecardell.com


All text and products presented are copyright. Copyright © 2015 Sarah Eve Cardell. All rights reserved.

• Heart Opening Vegan Chocolate
• Community LOVE & more!

When: Wednesday November 11th 2015

Time: 8-10:00 pm

*Please be respectful and arrive on time as we will open ceremony promptly.

Where: Jeanette Stoner Studio
83 Leonard Street 5th Floor
Tribeca NYC

Cost: $25 or two for $40 if one brings a friend.

RSVP for one: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2YC8XWYVCQJXQ

RSVP for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=UXF88JWC2AFFW

What is the Twin Flame frequency?
“Love for self, for the actualization of our whole selves, and Love in a romantic relationship with sacred intentions of mirroring and fulfillment: what we call a Sacred Partnership. Whether you are in a relationship, or in between, this evening will allow your soul to grow and expand into its true desire for higher harmony and creative purpose in relationship.

Guests Chela and Pedro of Sacred Soul Union embody the Twin Flame frequency, an evolutionary resonance uniting and balancing the divine masculine and feminine frequencies. The Twin Flame union pertains to all relationships in the spectrum of sexual orientation. They extend their joint healership as an offering to foster balance in this time of great, accelerated transformation.

Many Twin Flame couples are reuniting at this time, which beyond the personal is helping to heal the planet. This is by balancing distortions in gender that have caused suffering for so long on the planet, allowing a new type of leadership to emerge balanced in qualities of the divine feminine.

Being in relationship has a way of mirroring our full selves, the light and shadow, and can bring forth challenging aspects of ourselves that were previously unrecognized to be acknowledged, accepted, healed and transmuted. Paradoxically, it is also a way of experiencing in this earthly dimension the immense joy and bliss of how we are loved by spirit. The frequencies from this gathering intend to facilitate navigating these two aspects.

In order to manifest anything, we must first resonate at its' frequency. In this quantum leap space between "what is" and "what is possible" as it pertains to a sacred relationship, it is our intention that our offerings can assist to others so that the partner and relationship shows up with ease. This also applies to taking an existing relationship to a next level, or doing personal healing work as it relates to oneself.

Pedro and Chela have extended this work for the past two years to hundreds of recipients, and recently celebrated their wedding June of 2014. Their work is a testament to the power of love, harmony and acceptance in relationship. They have assisted many individuals in manifesting a partnership after a Twin Flame Activation, or deepening into new levels of intimacy and harmony with their current partner. Some have even met their beloved at a Twin Flame Activation event!” –Pedro and Chela Rosas


About Sacred Soul Union, Chela and Pedro:
Sacred Soul Union is the joint endeavor of healers Chela and Pedro Rosas. Together Chela and Pedro embody the “Twin Flame” frequency and commit their work together in healing service to the planet, to bring the sacred masculine and feminine into balance (as they relate to all spectrums of sexual orientation) and to assist others in finding fulfillment in sacred partnership.

Pedro De Las Rosas is divine channel, medium, shamanic healer and reverend. Born in Venezuela, he was initiated in Curanderismo at the age of 16. The culmination of his healership incorporates his practice of healing arts, shamanism, Buddhism and sound healing. Pedro feels a deep connection to his ancestry and has been actively guided by his great-grandmother, who was a renowned healer in Chile during the 20th century. Pedro is a ceremonial leader and is in service to the community through shamanic healing ceremonies and sweat lodges. He is guided by native traditions from the Amazon and other lineages. Pedro is also a celebrated documentary photographer, a skill that he employs to bring truth, justice and harmony to the planet.

Lauren "Chela" Harkrader Rosas is a Brennan Healing Science Practitioner, Reiki Master, doula and Reverend in the Oder of Melchizedek. She is a certified sound healer trained by Tom Kenyon and has also studied under Drunvalo Melchizedek. Chela is also a world traveled DJ; a singer/songwriter, fashion stylist, artist and performer. She weaves together many forms of artistic expression, incorporating prayer, activism, and sacred knowledge. Her early years were filled with expansive consciousness, raised as a Unitarian Universalist, spending years living in Nicaragua, and learning Reiki at 17 years old. She graduated Oberlin College with High Honors in Studio Art. Through her experience in healing transformation and overcoming many health challenges, she has awakened to know her own nature as divine bliss, which guides and informs her in assisting her clients. With compassion and presence that is gentle, playful and fierce, Chela believes we each possess the tools and guidance we need to become our own best healer and teacher.
https://www.facebook.com/SacredSoulUnion/?pnref=about.overview

Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you. www.sarahevecardell.com

East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

Wed

# of Sessions: 6

November 25
December 23

  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

results.description:
Come and have a great time enjoy a great workout with great people while potentially  getting a fantastic sunrise! :)  Check out the photos of prior sunrise hikes !!

Please adhere to the two golden rules!

 1) Hike Safe

2) Have Fun  :)

Please try to be the timely as the purpose of this hike is to catch the sunrise. If you are going to be late please leave a message on the meet up board.

Directions From NY Route 9D, look for Bob's Corner Store in Beacon. Turn east onto Howland Avenue. then immediately turn right into the parking area for Scenic Hudson's Mount Beacon Park.


Public Transportation: Metro-North Hudson Line to Beacon station -- walk uphill to trailhead

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding lookout point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson River and surrounding area.

Distance: 4 miles round trip


The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain. Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit. On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).


You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.


If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

How do leaders know when it is their moment to lead? How do leaders know what to do and when to do it? What do gutsy leaders seem to have in common with each other? 

Author, Entrepreneur and Leader, Terence Biggs II, will present a compelling presentation about leaders that are able to comfortably say, "I'm Made For This Moment."

Life repeatedly throughs us curve balls and as a result we have to develop gutsy transformational leadership skills that empowers us to lead in the midst of chaos. What are some of the common DNA traits observed in gutsy leaders that equips them to lead when others would rather run away? This is a probative presentation on the DNA of Gutsy Leaders.

results.description:
I have been volunteering with Diane at Saint Marks Episcopal Church Community Outreach Center where they serve breakfast and lunch every day to people in need and also distribute food to them. On the second Thursday of each month they get a large shipment from the USDA/SFPP that needs to be unloaded, sorted and then distributed to the people when they come. The unloading and sorting takes place from 9am to 1pm and then from 1- 6pm they need people to stay at stations as a family comes through to select their items to take home to re-stock their pantries. I plan to go at 9am and will stay as long as I can.

You can come any time during this 9am-6pm  time frame and stay at little or as long as you can, they will appreciate any amount of time that you give. They also will appreciate if you bring any grocery bags for the people to use to carry things home. Please call the center if you have further questions[masked] and like their facebook page for updates too:

https://www.facebook.com/SaintMarksKeansburg

Come out and make a difference!  Hope to see YOU there! 


Love, Cassie

*note* if you can lift go to this anytime if you can not lift then go to this anytime from 11am to 6pm to pass out food and clean up. I am going around noon
results.how_to_find_us: the center is the tan building next to the church
