results.description:
A symposium examining light pollution and it's impact on our health, natural functions of ecosystems, and energy conservation. 

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE -

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE -

In overlit cities and suburbs throughout the world, it has become nearly impossible to see the natural light of stars due to the flood of artificial light emanating from homes, buildings, outdoor advertisements, and street lamps. 


Join the Building Energy Exchange (BEEx) for a symposium examining light pollution and the many issues surrounding over-illumination.

Though easy to address in most situations, light pollution remains largely unchecked, with dire consequences for human health and well-being, the natural functioning of ecosystems, and energy conservation. Both humans and animals rely on the natural processes of light and darkness for healthy functioning, yet when the night sky is unnaturally and perpetually aglow, circadian rhythms are interrupted. Our sleep patterns can be negatively affected resulting in increased stress, fatigue, and anxiety. The migration of patterns of wildlife, and the feeding and reproduction habits of nocturnal animals are frequently thrown off-course. And the energy costs to society for having artificial lights glaring 24/7 has become unsupportable. The recent implementation of energy-saving outdoor lighting (such as the LED street light program in NYC) is reducing energy use but may not be adequately addressing human health and light pollution issues. 

This symposium will explore these issues and discuss both current and incoming solutions - Outdoor lights to design downward instead of upward or outward, sensors that turn outdoor lights off when not needed, and communities that demand technologically-advanced public and private night-lighting. These solutions can not only reduce the amount of energy and light used, but will also contain reflected and scattered light waves. 

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE -

The esteemed panel will include Jason Neches of L'Observatoire International, a leading lighting design consultancy spearheading the push to reduce nightglow, and Fred Maxik of Light Science Group, a leading manufacturer of advanced lighting products.

SPEAKERS
Jason Neches, Director, L'Observatoire International
Fred Maxik, Chief Technology Officer & Founding Member, Lighting Science Group
results.name: The Dark Side of Light:  Light Pollution (BEEx Event)

results.description:
HIKE IS ON. PLEASE BRING RAIN GEAR.                                                                  Leader: Dave Hogenauer,[masked]
Meet: 10 AM at the NYC lookout and 9/11 Memorial at Eagle Rock Reservation. See directions below under Eagle Rock Reservation. We will caravan to South Mountain and hike the Lenape Trail from there using the recently completed extension of the trail north of Mayapple Hill. Then we will traverse a number of residential streets, as well as local town parks ending up at Eagle Rock again for a hike of about 5 to 6 miles. Bring lunch and water. Hiking boots required. Watch this site on the morning of November 12 for any last minute changes/cancellations. Plan to arrive by 9:45 as we leave by 10 am.
DIRECTIONS: Eagle Rock Reservation
EAGLE ROCK RESERVATION, West Orange, NJ Coordinates: N40° 48.24', W74° 14.26'
I-280 Exit 8 onto Prospect Ave. north for 0.3 miles to Eagle Rock Ave. Go right (east) on Eagle Rock Ave. About 0.3 miles to park entrance on left. Meet near restaurant Highlawn Pavillion.
results.name: HIKE - Lenape Trail/Eagle Rock Reservation, W. Orange

Wow , time is flying by .......It is already time for yet another "Senior Lunch Social at Riverbank State Park". There will be a live band , and they will play our:            OLD FAVORITES   from back in the day.    This time there will be a "POP" band   named:   "REBIRTH".     Lunch will be provided so you will not have to bring anything but your dancing shoes.  No partner is ever needed  at the Senior Lunch Social .......    We just get up and dance with the group whenever the music moves us to get up and move.  

 Everyone planning to be at Riverbank State Park..... Don't forget the # 11 and the # 19 bus bring you right to the door. You know it is always a trek getting down to the Hudson River.       Once you get to 145th street, you can walk on down,  or,   grab the # 19 bus,  or,  hail a cab for the approximate 3 blocks.


I can not reserve a table with only 3 or 4 people attending so ... facing the stage, look for me at the tables on the left hand side. If this won't work because of other reservations, I will sit on the left hand side of the middle bleacher chairs. I will wear my new ORANGE HEAD BAND with the orange ribbons and orange flower. If I am not in a seat, look for me getting down on the dance floor. See you there

April Newman
results.how_to_find_us: I will be sitting  at a table if possible.  Finding me will be easy because:   I will be wearing my ORANGE headband.

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register

Slow performing, crashing and battery-hogging mobile apps causes user abandonment and negative ratings in the app stores. 

HP AppPulse Mobile is a new tool for mobile apps that solves exactly these problems! 

In this webinar, you’ll learn how to improve your mobile app’s performance and stability with a unique UX approach to mobile monitoring - in one hour! See how to easily reproduce crashes with the user action trail and how to improve your app UX with advanced error analytics. 

What you will learn: 

1) Why monitoring the UX and user actions is more critical than network requests 

2) How to spend less time fixing mobile apps and more time on enhancements 

3) Why Rendering Performance Matters 

4) How to easily reproduce crashes with user action trail 

Panelists: 

Avi Kabizon is the mobile team manager for the AppPulse Mobile product at Hewlett Packard Enterprise, focusing on mobile real-user application monitoring. He develops tools for web and mobile application analysis. 

Haim (Hemi) Shuvali has 10 years of experience with software design and engineering, among them 7 years @HP, in the APM and system monitoring domain, working closely with customers from one side to learn their needs and RnD from the other side to make sure we deliver the perfect product for HP customers.

This is FANTASTIC NEWS, and a direct result of the organizing efforts of all the groups and individuals who are a part of the Grassroots Alliance. We want to celebrate with you and thank the Governor, who'll be throwing a fundraiser in Manhattan tonight. Let's make it a HUGE crowd to let him know how much we appreciate his veto, and how much we want to support the offshore wind efforts that he is currently developing. Let's make New York a real leader in renewable energy!

results.description:
Efficient solution of structural default models with correlated jumps and mutual  obligations

Andrey Itkin

Seminar Program

5:45pm Registration
6:00pm Seminar
7:30pm Reception

Abstract

The structural default model of Lipton and Sepp, 2009 is generalized for a set of banks with mutual interbank liabilities whose assets are driven by correlated Levy processes with idiosyncratic and common components. The multi-dimensional problem is made tractable via a novel computational method, which generalizes the one-dimensional fractional partial differential equation method of Itkin, 2014 to the two- and three-dimensional cases. This method is unconditionally stable and of the second order of approximation in space and time; in addition, for many popular Levy models it has linear complexity in each dimension. Marginal and joint survival probabilities for two and three banks with mutual liabilities are computed. The effects of mutual liabilities are discussed, and numerical examples are given to illustrate these effects.

(Joint work with Alex Lipton)



Biography

Dr. Andrey Itkin is an Adjunct Professor at NYU, Department of Risk and Financial Engineering and Director, Senior Research Associate at Bank of America.  He received his PhD in physics of liquids, gases and plasma, and degree of Doctor of Science in computational molecular physics. During his academic carrier he published few books and multiple papers on chemical and theoretical physics and astrophysics, and later on computational and mathematical finance. Andrey occupied various research and managerial positions in financial industry and also is a member of multiple professional associations in finance and physics.


Disclaimer

This a joint IAQF/Thalesians seminar, and not an instructional program of New York University.
results.name: (NY) - Andrey Itkin - Efficient solution of structural default models

results.description:
Some time back, we went to a talk on Saratoga hosted by the Victorian Society in America, and now we're off to another event of theirs, that explores how Gothic-inspired themes in literature influenced architecture and other arts in our country in the 19th century.

Here's a description from the website: "British Gothic novels (most notably by Sir Walter Scott) and later nineteenth-century American historical fiction by James Fenimore Cooper, Washington Irving and Nathaniel Hawthorne influenced American artists and architects, including figures like Thomas Jefferson, Alexander Jackson Davis, Washington Allston, Thomas Cole and the actor Edwin Forrest. Kerry Dean Carso is Associate Professor of Art History at SUNY New Paltz. Her book American Gothic Art and Architecture in the Age of Romantic Literature received the Victorian Society in America's 2015 Henry-Russell Hitchcock Award."  Meet-the-Speaker Reception to follow.


Admission: Free. There is also our own $1 meetup fee, payable to the Meetup organizer, me.


How to meet us: We're meeting at 6 pm in the space where the talk is held  for this 6:30 pm talk; they may not seat until 6:15 pm. Join us there or else on line waiting to get into that space. I will be holding a handwritten sign that says MEETUP.

>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.

CREDIT SUISSE WELCOMES MEMBERS AND FRIENDS OF OP.LYNX TO LAMBDA LEGAL’S FESTIVE ANNUAL LBT WOMEN’S MIXER, ‘LIBATIONS AND LITIGATION.’

On Thursday, November 12, the Great Hall of Credit Suisse becomes the scene of the seventh edition of “Libations and Litigation,” Lambda Legal’s noteworthy annual LBT women’s networking event. . As one of the evening’s co-hosts, OP.LYNX, Out Professionals’ dynamic women’s network, is being joined by the women of Yale GALA, Columbia Pride, CUGALA of Cornell, DGALA of Dartmouth, FFR/Princeton TBGALA and Stanford Pride. On hand with an update on Lambda Legal’s vital impact litigation is Haley Gorenberg, Deputy Legal Director. Gorenberg recently testified to the President’s Task Force on 21st Century Policing and submitted testimony to the United Nations High Commissioner on Human Rights regarding the impact of the criminal justice system on LGBT people and those living with or affected by HIV.

Because of security requirements and space limitations, register now to celebrate and support women in the LGBT community and Lambda Legal’s work for LGBT equality. Enjoy the open bar’s stock of fine wine and beer, savor complimentary hors d’oeuvres, and rub shoulders with some of the city’s most fascinating women professionals.

WHAT’S UP
Networking and socializing from 6:00 to 8:00 p.m. Wine, beer and hors d’oeuvres compliments of Credit Suisse’s LGBT Open Network, the event’s generous underwriters. As a result, 100 per cent of your admission helps advance the vital work of Lambda Legal.

WHERE
The Great Hall of Credit Suisse, 1 Madison Avenue at 24th Street. Subway: N/R/6 to 23rd Street.

ADMISSION
Members and friends of OP.LYNX and other co-hosting organizations, $40. Students, $20. Security requirements and space limitations make pre-registration highly advisable. Walk-ins welcome, space permitting.

results.description:
REGISTER: https://goo.gl/kYhHJT    [do not register via Meetup.com]

Extreme Performance with Java Microservices for Low-latency Applications

Microservices is a very popular architectural model that is used by many large ecommerce and high-performance financial systems. Java is a perfect language to implement such systems.  But there some critical questions to ask when dealing with microservices.  When do you use microservices over a more simplistic monolithic model? With all those services separated for ease of development and management, can we get micro-second response times in such a microservices architecture? How can microservices help trading systems and other real-time applications to become easier to deploy and manage? How can we orchestrate and monitor these services?  Can reactive streams help here or what are the alternatives?

Code examples and technologies will be in Java using Chronicle Software, Aeron, Akka, Hazelcast.

REGISTER: https://goo.gl/kYhHJT    [do not register via Meetup.com]



PETER LAWREY BIO
Java Champion Peter Lawrey is internationally known as one of the premier experts on high-performance Java systems.  Peter is the founder of the "Performance Java User Group" and a top contributor to the Java/JVM forums on StackOverflow.  He is also technical lead for OpenHFT and an author of Chronicle, an ultra low-latency, messaging in-memory DB with latency as low as 80 nanoseconds.

results.description:
Hi, everyone.  Please join us and our three awesome presenters on Nov. 12th at 6 pm.  See you there! 

AGENDA

• Ad Tech Machine Learning: In Search of an Agile Platform. Keynote Presentation by Giri Iyengar from AOL

• Open Source Analytics - Domain Specific Analytics with System ML

• Running Spark workloads on GPUs – Demonstration


1.  Keynote Presentation by Giri Iyengar from AOL

Ad Tech Machine Learning: In Search of an Agile Platform 


At AOL Platforms, we tackle all aspects of Ad Tech, from problems on the buy side to the sell side and all things in between. We deal with many varied data sets across different business units, including auction data, campaigns, behavior and content. Data sizes are in petabytes across multi-100 node clusters. Given the heterogeneous development and production environments across our different groups, we are missing out on the opportunity for uniting the capabilities and experience of many strong data scientists across the organization through easy sharing of knowledge and expertise gained over challenging project experiences.

In this discussion, we will share the types of problems we tackle and the ways that we approach solving them through machine learning and data engineering. We will touch on some of the practical issues involved, such as data challenges and production deployment challenges. We will also talk about the platforms we have used and what we are still looking for in terms of an Enterprise-grade machine learning platform.

BIO - GIRI IYENGAR

Giri Iyengar is a Chief Architect in the Data Services tribe at AOL Platforms. He works on Data Science projects and bringing them into production at large scale at AOL. At AOL he has worked on pricing models, forecasting models, user matching models and yield optimization. Prior to AOL, he was the CTO of Velos, a Machine Learning startup that was acquired by AOL earlier this year. He started his career as a Research Scientist at IBM TJ Watson Lab after his PhD from MIT.

--------------------------------------------------------

2.  Presentation by IBM

Open Source Analytics - Domain Specific Analytics with System ML.

Declarative large-scale machine learning (ML) in SystemML aims at flexible specification of ML algorithms and automatic generation of hybrid runtime plans ranging from single node, in-memory computations to distributed computations on MapReduce or Spark. ML algorithms are expressed in an R-like syntax or a Python-like syntax, that includes linear algebra primitives, statistical functions, and ML-specific constructs. This high-level language significantly increases the productivity of data scientists as it provides:
- full flexibility in expressing custom analytics, and
data independence from the underlying input formats and physical data representations.
- automatic optimization according to data and cluster characteristics ensures both efficiency and scalability. As such, SystemML differs from existing work on large-scale ML libraries, which mostly provide fixed algorithms and runtime plans.

In June 2015, IBM announced to open source SystemML and include it in the Apache Spark project. The open source repository is here: https://github.com/SparkTC/systemml

This meetup will provide a high level overview of System ML and cover use cases and client examples of how System ML is used.

3. Running Spark workloads on GPUs - Demonstration


Live demonstration and benchmark comparison of running machine learning workloads on Apache Spark leveraging GPUs - achieving 20x performance improvement without the need of modifying the application. Demonstration provided by IBM Research.
results.name: Machine Learning: Ad Tech ML; System ML - Large Scale Declarative ML

Please join us for a fireside chat with Jesse Jacoby, Founder of Emergent on Thursday, November 12th from 6 - 8 pm.

Jesse Jacoby is a sought-after change and transformation consultant and speaker. He is the founder of Emergent (www.emergentconsultants.com), a boutique consulting firm that partners with Fortune 500 and mid-market companies to help build internal change capability and execute business transformation initiatives. Jesse and the Emergent team are developers of two online organizational performance tools: Change Accelerator and Savvy Transition. He is also the publisher of Emergent Journal and the Emergent Insights newsletter.


Jesse possesses a unique blend of organizational change management, product development, and program leadership skills. Prior to founding Emergent, he spent a decade leading successful consulting engagements for Booz & Company, Accenture, and Right Management (Manpower) across multiple industries, including retail, automotive, financial services, healthcare, transportation, and energy. Prior to his consulting career, Jesse served as Director at COS, Inc. (now Pivot), where he developed and marketed online information products for the scientific research community.


Jesse holds MBA and MS degrees. He serves on the Executive Committee of the Johns Hopkins University Alumni Council as well as on the Dean’s Advisory Board for the Carey Business School. Jesse has contributed to a number of forums, including PMI, ProjectsAtWork, Forrester, TechTarget, Leadership & Change, and the Association for Talent Development.

Fireside chat format:

• 6:00 - 6:30 pm: Open Networking

• 6:30 - 7:15 pm: Fireside Chat using a Q&A approach, (35mins between speaker and organizer, and 10mins between speaker and audience)

Save the date! Bring your questions & thoughts. This month we will do our best to cover some of the security issues and hacker news of the day. We also will have a special guest (who will talk about their work).

# WHAT'S A CRYPTOPARTY ## ## ## ## 
Cryptoparty Harlem: 

Sorry no chips, dip, awesome music or drinks. Just food for your mind. Ever wonder how to stay private, safe, & secure in today's digital age? What is a cryptoparty anyway? A CryptoParty is free, public and fun. People bring their computers, mobile devices,  and a willingness to learn! In the time of the event, people will learn and teach how to use basic cryptography tools. <a href="http://cryptoparty.in">Cryptoparties are decentralized global events that are organized to answer questions and instruct people on technology & privacy. Cryptoparties are always free to attend, public, commercially and politically non-aligned and absolutely against sexual harassment and discrimination.

There are no dumb questions, you do not need to know anything about this subject, nor do you even need to bring a computer or phone. However that will help you get the most of it. For more information see the global cryptoparty website:

</a>http://www.cryptoparty.in/

# WHEN ## ## ## ##

Thursday, November 12th, 2015 @ 5:45pm (-9pm)

# WHY ## ## ## ##

The last cryptoparty was in September but it was a closed door meeting w/ the co-organizers, some guests, and @quinnnorton to host #snackingteam in New York City.

We are back with an event open to the entire group right on the heels of the Brooklyn Public Library , cryptoparty on Monday November 9th, 2015. 

<a href="https://www.twitter.com/geminiimatt">@geminiimatt will present his journosec workout presentation from ONA (online news association)'s 2015 conference in Los Angeles. There he gave a 5 minute lightning talk on easy security tips for journalists (& activists). Just exactly what you to go from easy prey, to o.k! (that rhymes)

we are proud to announce that @bcrypt will be our very special guest!!!


and of course we will be available to answer, discuss, teach, and learn about secure mobile use, secure browsing (using tor), secure email (using gpg), and secure chat (using otr). 

# BUT WHY HARLEM?! ## ## ##

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EDq-OzMWQwg

 A lot of people don't know that back in December of 2013 NYC lauched The Harlem WiFi network (</a>http://harlemfreewifi.com/) rolled out by Sky-Packets ( <a href="http://www.sky-packets.com/muni-wifi/">http://www.sky-packets.com/muni-wifi/ ) it extends 95 city blocks, from 110th to 138th Streets between Frederick Douglass Boulevard and Madison Avenue making it at the time the largest continuous free outdoor public wireless network in the nation. The internet is literally all around us and free in Harlem! Throw in the fact that african americans over index on mobile phone usage (92% of African Americans own a cell phone, and 56% own a smartphone). So what better place to learn about using tech safely.

@geminiimatt has lived in harlem for over a decade and has seen it change for the good & bad. However one thing that has stayed the same is the high level of surveillance & scrutiny faced by residents.  ONLINE: Please read Ben Popper's examination of the fallout from NYPD's Operation Crew Cut ,  "How the NYPD is using social media to put Harlem teens behind bars" (http://www.theverge.com/2014/12/10/7341077/nypd-harlem-crews-social-media-rikers-prison) , ON THE CORNER: Via official nypd cctv surveillance cameras & private owned cameras & FROM UP ABOVE: via SkyWatch tactical platform units and shotspotter (</a>https://www.aclu.org/blog/free-future/shotspotter-ceo-answers-questions-gunshot-detectors-cities), gunshot detection devices.

TWO FACTOR AUTHENTICATION:

the above link takes you to a list of sites that use 2-step verification.  2-step verification uses your name, password, but then another unknown to piece of info to log in. It can be provided by a hardware token, a texted code or via apps like Google Authenticator, Authy, etc. you can also use the site to help by requesting groups start using 2-step verification.

results.description:
The Apollo Theater reflects back on the career of James Brown with a documentary screening, "Mr. Dynamite: The Rise of James Brown", followed by panel discussion. To attend, RSVP here with the HarlemGo Meetup group, or use the Apollo's registration on Eventbrite here and let them know you heard about it through the HarlemGo Meetup. 


From the Apollo Theater:


Soul Brother No. 1. The Godfather of Soul. The Hardest Working Man in Show Business. Mr. Dynamite! These are just some of the names by which James Brown was known during a career that spanned more than 50 years. For our first Live Wire of the new season we pay homage to this Apollo Hall of Fame inductee with a screening of the acclaimed documentary, Mr. Dynamite: the Rise of James Brown, directed by the Oscar(R)- and Emmy(R)- winner Alex Gibney. The film covers the peak of Brown’s career with rare video clips, never-before-seen photographs from his estate, and fresh interviews with some of his closest personal and musical associates. The result is new insight into a man whose life and career made an indelible and everlasting impact on entertainment and culture. Harry Weinger, a special consultant to the film and a two-time Grammy(R) winner, will lead a panel discussion following the screening.

“A smart, informative and compassionate look at the artist known as the Godfather of Soul, whose music changed America.” – The New York Times


“As honest as it could possibly be… This documentary did a lot right… (it) is incredible and is a must see.” – The Source

Join in on the discussion!  Tweet us your questions at @ApolloEd using #ApolloLW and someone may answer them during the event!


###########

Our Meetup!

We'll meet in the Apollo Theater lobby at 6pm, then head up as a group around 6:30pm. If you need to arrive later than 6:30pm, it's ok - just state that you're with the HarlemGo Meetup group at the desk - but, please try to arrive as close to 6:30pm as possible for best seating - the event is scheduled to be at capacity!

As always, if you have any questions, comments, running late, trying to find us at the venue, or to check on last minute status updates on the event, please use the comments/notifications section below or feel free to call/text me Daniel @ 774.275.3646. Thanks!

Directions to the Apollo Theater


- Take the A, B, C or D trains to 125th Street and walk 1.25 blocks east to the Apollo Theater.
- Take the 2 or 3 trains to 125th Street and walk 1.75 blocks West to the Apollo Theater.
- Nearby public bus stops are the M2, M3, M10, M60, M101, M104, and BX15

For those that are driving, there are several street & private parking options in the area.

About Apollo Live Wire
Apollo Live Wire events are free and open to the public. Audiences include students, professionals, and other individuals with a desire to hear an engaging conversation, while increasing their knowledge of the subject matter. Apollo Live Wire discussions focus on topics pertinent to the history of the Apollo Theater and the Theater’s role in shaping American entertainment.

About the Apollo Theater
Since introducing the first Amateur Night contests in 1934, the Apollo Theater has played a major role in the emergence of innovative musical genres including jazz, swing, bebop, R&B, gospel, blues, soul and hip-hop. Based on its cultural significance and architecture, the Apollo Theater received state and city landmark designation in 1983 and is listed on the National Register of Historic Places.
results.how_to_find_us: Meetup in the Apollo Theater lobby, then go inside as a group
results.name: Apollo Theater LIVE WIRE Discussion Series: Mr. Dynamite - Free to Attend

results.description:
PLEASE PURCHASE YOUR TICKET AT NYC UXPA, HERE!

World Usability Day 2015: Innovation in Civic Design

Innovation can mean different things to different people, but most agree that it includes inventions and changes in products and services that improve a situation or solve a problem in a new way. Applying innovation in the civic space can improve the experience of people across a diverse array of backgrounds and needs, allowing them to do what they need to do in the public sphere, from changing their address with the DMV to registering to vote. 

Join Bloomberg, NYC UXPA, and IxDA NYC for World Usability Day 2015 on Thursday, November 12 at LMHQ. Whitney Quesenbery and Mollie Ruskin will be joining to share their work in civic design.

About the Presenters: 

Whitney Quesenbery
Whitney combines a fascination with people and an obsession to communicate clearly with her goal of bringing user research insights to designing products where people matter.

She’s also passionate about civic design. As co-director of the non-profit, non-partisan Center for Civic Design with Dana Chisnell, she works with election officials to improve the usability and design of elections. They publish the popular Field Guides to Ensuring Voter Intent. Her interest in UX, accessibility and civic design came together when she served as UPA’s representative on the Access Board’s advisory committee, drafting updates for the U.S. “Section 508″ accessibility regulations.

Her books— A Web for Everyone (with Sarah Horton, Rosenfeld Media), Storytelling for User Experience (with Kevin Brooks,Rosenfeld Media) and Global UX (with Daniel Szuc)—help practitioners keep users in mind throughout the creative process.


Mollie Ruskin


There’s something new in civic design: innovation From re-imagining a better immigration process to creating UI standards for use across thousands of government websites, designers are playing an increasingly key role in tackling some of our major public sector challenges. To succeed as designers within large government bureaucracies, we need passion, skill, a deep understanding of our context and an unfettered dedication to creating the best possible experience for our users - the American people. Mollie will share stories from her design teams inside of the government working to build beautiful human-centered public services. We'll hear about the role of UX and the process for delivering great government products, as well as learn about opportunities for you to get involved in these efforts to bring innovation and design into our 21st century government.

Mollie is a founding member of the U.S. Digital Service, where she works to improve the government's ability to deliver beautiful, human and intuitive technology and services. For the past ten years, Mollie has worked at the intersection of design and social justice, beginning as an advocate and community organizer before turning to a career in design.

In 2013, Mollie served as a Presidential Innovation Fellow at the Department of Veteran’s Affairs, where she led an human-centered design project to improve Veterans’ experiences with VA services. At the US Digital Service, she has worked on projects ranging from immigration to social security benefits, always bringing the needs of the people to the forefront of how services are designed. Most recently, Mollie led the effort to create the U.S. Web Design Standards to create a federal government web design system.
results.name: Suggested Event: NYC World Usability Day 2015 (Purchase Ticket Through UXPA)

PLEASE REGISTER THROUGH EVENTBRITE!

Product management has become one of the most strategic roles at large organizations. But the discipline is in its infancy, as we are still rapidly uncovering best practices and approaches.

What will product management look like five years from now? What about in a decade?

Join us for an evening with some of the brightest minds in the industry to discuss the skills, mindset, and tools that organizations and product managers will need to prepare for the future.Our panelists include:


Valla Vakili
Entrepreneur in Residence at Citi Ventures

Jeremiah Zinn
Head of Product at Bark & Co

Jeanette Mcclellan
Chief Product Officer at LifeReimagined, an AARP startup

Helen Bui
Founder of Stash-it, and former Head of Innovation Management at NewsCorp

Josh Wexler
VP of Product at Yieldmo


Event details:


Light snacks and beverages will be served.

Would you like to -

• Become a more confident public speaker?

•Feel more at-ease during business meetings and social occasions?

•Make new friends, in a supportive and encouraging environment?

The friendly people at Pride Toastmasters would love to help you improve your public speaking skills, as you boost your leadership and self confidence skills! We focus on making our guests very welcome. We meet every Thursday from 6:15 p.m. until 7:25 at the LGBT Center, 208 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011. If you arrive early, expect to be warmly greeted and given an overview of what to expect during the fun, informative and engaging meeting! 

By the way, there’s nothing for you to prepare in advance of our meeting, no fee to pay as our guest and no pressure to join.  Please do visit and sample this exciting option for personal and professional growth!

An average of 20 members and guests attend each Pride Toastmasters meeting. Since most aren't members of Meetup, the attendance figures shown here are always much lower.

Please visit our web site at http://www.PrideToastmasters.com

Come and meet our community of local real estate investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. We constantly learn & earn together and have fun together. Within our real estate investing community, we train people with no experience to people who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So it's not important what experience you have! Working with our community, you will learn in depth knowledge of how real estate investing strategies work and you will also develop yourself to be a successful real estate entrepreneur.

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about new investors that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, we will also talk about how you can make $1,000-$10,000 commissions helping our community grow and you will learn working strategies from professional and practicing Real Estate Investors on how to create wealth through real estate investing.. This way you can learn & earn, get educated so you can invest in real estate, enjoy your life and pass your wealth on to future generations. Because we will cover a LOT of things in a short amount of time such as saving money on taxes, investment opportunities and other ways to make money working with our team, only those who attend the orientation will get invited to private follow up meetings to cover more in depth advanced strategies and working with our community.

To attend, simply RSVP & answer the registration questions for location! If you would like to bring a friend or business partner with you to the meeting, please email us their name, email address and phone number so that we can make sure they are registered for the meeting.

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

 

==> Learning & Practice RESOURCES

Various materials http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/thread/3199165/0#[masked]

KANJI http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1175397
KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Please click over DISCUSSIONS ->Message Board, then select your favorite topic. Have a lot of FUN learning about Nihon & Nihongo! http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me, with the pile of Japanese dictionaries at one of the tables in the Atrium, or one of the other groups speaking in and about Japanese.

results.description: From the bestselling author of the Mrs. Pollifax books comes a new mystery habit to acquire. From the moment Sister John and Sister Hyacinthe reach the old house left to their abbey by a mysterious benefactor, their cloistered world begins to crumble. First, there is the wounded man hiding in the house, then the suitcase stuffed with money sitting at the bottom of the well, not to mention fearful apparitions in the night. Lord only knows what's going on. That is, until the good sisters, armed only with their faith and boundless energy, set things right--even if it means a shocking revelation or two about ghosts, gangsters...and murder.

results.description:
The Morris Museum will host its 2nd annual Night of Bourbon and Beards. This all-inclusive celebration, co-presented by the Garden State Beard and Mustache Society, will feature bourbon and beer tastings, food, a beard and mustache competition, live music, and a photography exhibition of contemporary beards. Proceeds from the night support art and science programming at the Morris Museum. 

The party will begin with a selection of bourbons (including Bib and Tucker Bourbon, Bower Hill Reserve Bourbon, James Oliver Rye “Bootlegger Special”, and Deanston Virgin oak unfiltered Single Malt Scotch), beers from micro-breweries, and two signature cocktails. We will also be offering a coupon from Steer Clear, who will drive your car and you home after the event. 

Filling the Museum's galleries will be the sweet sounds of the Black Flamingos. Based out of Asbury Park, New Jersey, this instrumental trio combines elements of surf, spy and spaghetti western music. The evening's activities will include straight razor shaves compliments of American Shave and cigar rolling techniques as demonstrated by Maxum Cigar. An autographed Jets football from Cornerback Darrelle Revis and four tickets to the December 13, 2015 Jets regular season home game against the Tennessee Titans will be the prizes for the night's raffle. 

The highlight of the celebration will be a beard and moustache contest, judged by Matt Chrystal, President, Garden State Beard and Mustache Society, and three other members of the Garden State Beard and Mustache Society. The competition winner will receive tickets to the Morris Museum Bickford Theatre and a Morris Museum Family Membership. 

In conjunction with the event, the Museum will display a photography exhibition of contemporary beards. Featuring the work of artists from across the country, the exhibition will showcase portraits of awe-inspiring beards and mustaches, as well as photographs of recent beard championship competitions. Artists include Greg Anderson, Jeffrey Moustache, Ross McDermott, and Dan Ostergren. The exhibition will be on view at the Museum through the month of November. 

Tickets are $35 in advance; $40 at the door. Tickets may be purchased online at <a>www.morrismuseum.org,</a> by phone at (973)[masked], or in person at the Bickford Theatre Box Office. Please note that you must be 21 of age or older to participate in this event. Food and drinks are being generously provided by Cambridge Wines, The Tipsy Penguin, Tito’s Burritos and Wings, Whole Foods Market, and Encore Catering. 

http://www.morrismuseum.org/benefit-events/

**Today (11/9), there is a "flash sale" for $30 tickets.
results.name: A Night of Bourbon and Beards at Morris Museum

results.description:
Advanced Italian through reading If you like reading in Italian, this course is for you!!!!

We will read “Scontro di civiltà per un ascensore a piazza vittorio” by author Amara Lakhous (available also in eBook). The author attempts to reveal a great and contemporary side of the Italian culture.

This course is geared to introduce students to selected readings in Italian culture, through which they expand their vocabulary and learn new grammar. Students also learn more about cultural issues within the Italian context and develop competence in critical analysis from a global perspective. Readings are in Italian and discussions are in Italian and English.

Come join us for some stimulating conversation!!

Weekly beginning Thursday Nov. 12 until December 17–

— 6 lessons (weekly) from 6:30 to 7:30pm.

Price: 150$

Minimum 4 participants – please enroll here:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/new-york-italians-advanced-italian-through-reading-tickets-19127276198

A presto,

NYI Team

results.description:
On Thursday, November 12th, we will listen to stories of women leading design at some of the most highly respected brands and innovative startups in New York. Each HER speaker will share their story - everything from their 10 year old selves to the key milestones that lead them to where they are today.


We’ll will also hear about their design process and how it’s driving innovation for their companies. Throughout the night, we’ll get a sense to also hear about the projects they are currently working on and where they see themselves going. Tonight is all about celebrating women in New York who are changing how we use products. We are fortunate to be able to host this at a beautiful Soho loft space who is generously providing an open bar and appetizers. We’re looking forward to seeing you there!

*Please RSVP here by November 11th using the code hervip for a discounted ticket!

Agenda : 

6:30-7:30: Join us for drinks

7:30-8:30: Hear from the amazing speakers, plus Q&A

Featured Women...

DAGNY PRIETO

Dagny currently leads in innovation and product design at one of the biggest media companies in the world, TIME Magazine. She invents, tests and designs products for mobile and web. She specializes in UI, UX, transactional consumer and B2B applications for web and mobile. Prior to joining as the VP of UX + Innovation at Time, She was also a consultant that provided design, user experience and strategy to Web-based consumer and B2B companies seeking better conversion, tighter strategy and cleaner, user-centric design.

MELISSA PERRI

Melissa is a product development and process consultant. She currently teaches enterprises about how to be more innovative, and also teaches startups about launching products that people love. Melissa specializes in Product Management, Product Strategy, and UX Research/Design. Working in the Lean Startup methodology, Melissa has become an expert and speaks on Lean Product Management and Lean UX around the world. Melissa frequently runs private and public workshops on UX Design, MVPs, and Lean Product Management. Melissa is also the Agile 2015 UX track co-chair.

ERIN LEFORCE

Erin is a native Oklahoman, an illustrator by studies and digital designer by happy chance. She has lived and worked in NYC for four years. Currently, she is a product designer at Ustwo where she collaborates with a team of talented designers to create innovative products that ignite the digital landscape. Prior to Ustwo, Erin worked as a senior designer at Huge where she led the vision for a wide range of digital projects, from healthcare, to e-commerce & marketing strategies. When she is not designing for the Internet she can be found exploring the city and eating her way through the city's most blogged about eateries.

Hosted by:
results.name: HER : Product Design

results.description:
Irresistible Change – An Intro to Weight Loss Using Hypnosis+NLP

What is it you want to Change about your Life?

Imagine "YOU":

• Thinner • More confident • Less stressed • Better focused

Imagine You Achieving Your Goal

Imagine You Living a Better Life

If you've got a desire to make that vision a reality, to attain the life, the body and goals you want, then you can join us for an information and experiential evening and start to Learn these skills NOW.

If you want to see, hear and feel new ways to change your relationship, beliefs and habits, then come hang out for a few hours And begin to learn how to use hypnosis+NLP to help yourself and others.

This is a hands-on class for those interested learning/experiencing/practicing some of the basic hypnosis, NLP, trance and other transformational skills so they might help themselves &/or others.  The skills of hypnosis & NLP are both practical and magical.  These skills are based on the way our brains naturally work.  And they are simple, organic and easy to learn.  Come Join Us!

Each month we will explore the basics &/or different elements of NLP & Hypnosis and we will often close with a group trance.

This month - WEIGHT LOSS

Newcomers and experienced Practitioners are all welcome.

Your Habits, Beliefs & Behaviors are Patterns some Good, some Bad

Use Your Most Powerful & Hidden Resources & Abilities to create Change

Imagine using all the knowledge, experience, resources and abilities you have NOW, to create better choices.  Perhaps, you’ve seen stage hypnosis shows or read some novel, seem some movie featuring the power of hypnosis.  Well, fiction is fiction, and the folks on stage are specifically chosen by the hypnotist for there ability to be most suggestible.  You might not be as easily hypnotizable as those people, but everyone goes into trance, everyone has the ability to use their imagination and to make change.

If you want to find out how powerfully you can go into trance or make change, Come Join Us!

===================================

Visit website to Learn More

===================================

=================================

CLICK HERE to Pay

$35 Regular Price

$25 Early Price (available until 3 days before event)

=================================

Train Your Brains: An Intro to Hypnosis+NLP

Description of Class:
This is a hands-on class for those interested learning/experiencing some of the basic hypnosis, NLP, trance and other transformational skills so they might help themselves &/or others.

Duration: 2 hours

What will you learn?

This is a hands-on class.  Every class is different and we will focus on different aspects of Hypnosis+NLP.  And we’ll give plenty of time to practice these skills.  Examples of some of the things you will learn/practice/experience are:

Experience How to:

* easily and effortlessly hypnotize yourself

* get rid of negative messages you tell yourself

* go deeper into relaxation then you've ever been before

* eliminate or reduce cravings, habits or beliefs

* enjoy better health

* change limiting blocks that have prevented you from reaching your goals

* build amazing positive and resilient states of calm, confidence, happiness and more in yourself & others

*improve rapport and communication

Learn:

* the history of hypnosis & NLP*
* the myths & benefits of hypnosis & NLP
* the signs of trance
* the neurology of breaking old habits and creating new habits
* the master pattern for most changework
* how to take hold of frames, set the context and story
* the power of metaphors
* the use of small shifts in your experience to create massive change

Who is this class for?
This class is for anyone that is for anyone who is curious about hypnosis, NLP and changework and how they can impact their life or the lives of others.

Whats required for this class?
Nothing is required for the class.  Just bring your curiosity, a willingness to explore, to learn and be open to the possibility of becoming massively different in a really good way.

=================================

CLICK HERE to Pay

$35 Regular Price

$25 Early Price (available until 3 days before event)

Many thanks to our sponsor, breather.com, for use of their awesome space. Check out Breather's network of over 40 beautiful spaces in New York City, where you can work, meet, relax, or even host your own Meetups, on-demand, at breather.com or through their iOS and Android apps.

***** Seating is on a 1st come, 1st serve basis, while there is plenty of floor space, currently there are only 8-10 chairs available. Folks who come later are welcome to stand or sit on the floor. We encourage you to bring a yoga mat or something to sit on.

=================================

Visit website to Learn More

===================================

About Joel

Joel Elfman is a Hypnotist, and Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) trainer with over 14 years of experience. He has taught NLP and Hypnosis in over 400+ Meetups for thousands of people.

Joel specializes in creating safe spaces for clients to generate lasting change. He helps to transform old problems into new positive habits, beliefs and ways of enjoying life. Areas of focus include losing weight, building confidence, reducing stress and more.

http://www.joelelfman.com

Visit my website for answers to Frequently Asked Questions about NLP & Hypnosis

*NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming) is often called the study of subjective reality, how each individual uniquely experiences, processes and communicates with the world around them. Once an individual's patterns are modeled, the tools of NLP are highly effective in creating change.

<a href="http://www.joelelfman.com/faqs--clinical-research.html"></a>

results.description:
The WCC Fall - Winter Dinner Programs are a great way for you to meet and greet your cycling friends and to meet new members. Since we plan the table seating so that all tables are full, you will meet other members at any table you choose.

Our guest speaker, Lori Hoefer, is a 20 year veteran of the cycling industry, She founded  Wheel Wisdom, an educational consulting firm which seeks to enhance cycling related experiences through programs designed to develop cycling skills, knowledge and ability.

Lori is a 20 Year Veteran of the bicycling industry and has worked in every facet of cycling. She is a Founding Team Member of the Serotta Professional Bike Fit School and is a highly regarded professional bike fitter.  Lori was also a competitive, nationally ranked racer. 

 A multi course buffet dinner will be served for the all inclusive price of $27.00.

 Register early to reserve seat. If your plans change, you can receive a full refund up to 3 days before the dinner. There is parking on Mamaroneck Ave or in the large Municipal Lot adjoining the restaurant.

If you have any questions, contact Al Kaplan :  [masked]

or Annmarie Viaggio:  [masked]

results.description:
DigitalOcean and Opbeat will be co-hosting an evening of mad science Node.js talks & discussion. We’ll be bringing together a stellar line-up of Node.js speakers for this one-off NYC event. Join us and other like-minded developers at the DigitalOcean HQ for an evening of talks, conversation and snacks.

6:30pm - Register, dinner and drinks

7:00pm - Mathias Buus | @mafintosh

Mathias is a Node.js hacker who has written over 350 modules on npm. Known for mad science projects, recently he’s been working on https://github.com/mafintosh/peerflix, a streaming bittorrent video client.

Mathias has previously spoken at jsDay, JSConf, NodeSummit, NodeConf to name a few.

7:45pm - Thomas Watson

Thomas is an open-source developer and NodeSchool organiser. He’s the proud author of node module 100,000, has implemented AirPlay support in Node, and is co-author of Volkswagen, a service that detects when your tests are being run in a CI server, and makes them pass.

Thomas has previously spoken at NodeConf, JSConf, & devDK.

8:30pm - Stick around and meet the team 

_______________________________________

Want to make a 20 minute Node.js talk? Send an email to [masked]

 (no product pitches please)

About Opbeat

Opbeat is the simple application monitoring service that shows you where your app needs optimising. Opbeat integrates with git, so you can see performance at the code level. 

Videos from this event will be posted at https://opbeat.com/events/ and DigitalOcean YouTube.
results.how_to_find_us: Please bring your photo ID to check into the building
results.name: Mad science Node.js meetup with DigitalOcean & Opbeat

results.description:
It's time to break the stereotype. Writers aren't the lazy professionals. In fact, we work harder and have more decision making skills than your average office worker.
We will convene at a comfortable location at a beautiful office space where each writer's unique workflow will be nurtured and cultivated. 

We will work for 2 hours and you'll be surprised at how much you'll get done. There will be planned breaks in between for refreshments and socializing. 

There is a $20 fee to pay for the space. You will have access to five bathrooms, closet space, electrical sockets, and coffee. Best of all, you won't have to worry if anyone will steal your stuff. This fee also includes unlimited access and support to our project managers and editors. Unlimited edits and critiques will be given as long as you are a member and continue to attend weekly meet up events.
results.name: Writers Who Write

results.description:
Girl Develop It is organizing a Resume & LinkedIn Workshop (and networking too) on Thursday, November 12th from 6:30 to 8:30pm specifically for women. 

With the guidance and expertise of women professionals, we’ll spend the night revising each others resumes, reviewing LinkedIn profiles and discussing how to use social media professionally. We’ll also have an informal discussion about entry level tech careers and how different folks have made that career transition.

Tech HR Professionals will lead the discussion for the evening. Come prepared with a copy of your resume, laptop to view your GitHub account and LinkedIn profile. WHERE: Stack Exchange
WHEN: Thursday, November 12th from 6:30-9:30pm
WHAT: Networking with other women while perfecting your resume & LinkedIn profile
WHY: Because everyone needs an awesome resume & LinkedIn to get the job of their dreams!

A $10 donation to the Girl Develop It scholarship fund is requested for your registration.

results.description:
NaNoWriMo = National Novel Writing Month = 50,000 Words in 30 days

Every November thousands of folks sit down and write 1667 words per day to get to the end goal of 50,000 words. When hit your goal you win your novel or the beginnings of one.

From NaNoWriMo 

National Novel Writing Month (NaNoWriMo) is a fun, seat-of-your-pants approach to creative writing. 

On November 1, participants begin working towards the goal of writing a 50,000-word novel by 11:59 PM on November 30.

Valuing enthusiasm, determination, and a deadline, NaNoWriMo is for anyone who has ever thought about writing a novel.

Come join us as we write our novels or if you just want to sit and write what you are working on in a group.  We will start at 6:30 until closing.  Come anytime between then.

results.description:
Irresistible Change – An Intro to Weight Loss Using Hypnosis+NLP

What is it you want to Change about your Life?

Imagine "YOU":

• Thinner • More confident • Less stressed • Better focused

Imagine You Achieving Your Goal

Imagine You Living a Better Life

If you've got a desire to make that vision a reality, to attain the life, the body and goals you want, then you can join us for an information and experiential evening and start to Learn these skills NOW.

If you want to see, hear and feel new ways to change your relationship, beliefs and habits, then come hang out for a few hours And begin to learn how to use hypnosis+NLP to help yourself and others.

This is a hands-on class for those interested learning/experiencing/practicing some of the basic hypnosis, NLP, trance and other transformational skills so they might help themselves &/or others.  The skills of hypnosis & NLP are both practical and magical.  These skills are based on the way our brains naturally work.  And they are simple, organic and easy to learn.  Come Join Us!

Each month we will explore the basics &/or different elements of NLP & Hypnosis and we will often close with a group trance.

This month - WEIGHT LOSS


Newcomers and experienced Practitioners are all welcome.

Your Habits, Beliefs & Behaviors are Patterns some Good, some Bad

Use Your Most Powerful & Hidden Resources & Abilities to create Change

Imagine using all the knowledge, experience, resources and abilities you have NOW, to create better choices.  Perhaps, you’ve seen stage hypnosis shows or read some novel, seem some movie featuring the power of hypnosis.  Well, fiction is fiction, and the folks on stage are specifically chosen by the hypnotist for there ability to be most suggestible.  You might not be as easily hypnotizable as those people, but everyone goes into trance, everyone has the ability to use their imagination and to make change.

If you want to find out how powerfully you can go into trance or make change, Come Join Us!

Train Your Brains: An Intro to Hypnosis+NLP

This is a hands-on class for those interested learning/experiencing some of the basic hypnosis, NLP, trance and other transformational skills so they might help themselves &/or others.

Duration: 2 hours

What will you learn?

This is a hands-on class.  Every class is different and we will focus on different aspects of Hypnosis+NLP.  And we’ll give plenty of time to practice these skills.  Examples of some of the things you will learn/practice/experience are:

Experience How to:

* easily and effortlessly hypnotize yourself

* go deeper into relaxation then you've ever been before

* build amazing positive and resilient states of calm, confidence, happiness and more in yourself & others

* the use of small shifts in your experience to create massive change

Who is this class for?
This class is for anyone that is for anyone who is curious about hypnosis, NLP and changework and how they can impact their life or the lives of others.

Whats required for this class?
Nothing is required for the class.  Just bring your curiosity, a willingness to explore, to learn and be open to the possibility of becoming massively different in a really good way.

About Joel

Joel Elfman is a Hypnotist, and Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) trainer with over 14 years of experience. He has taught NLP and Hypnosis in over 400+ Meetups for thousands of people.

Joel specializes in creating safe spaces for clients to generate lasting change. He helps to transform old problems into new positive habits, beliefs and ways of enjoying life. Areas of focus include losing weight, building confidence, reducing stress and more.

Do you have bills? Do you have a lot of money left over after you pay them?

Do you spend more time doing what you HAVE to do instead if what you WANT to do?

Does your boss get more time with you than your family?

You are meant for so much more than you settle for. You are an incredible being and you can feel it. Everyday you think about where you are and wonder "is this it?" You don't have to keep living that way. In fact you shouldn't. I'm pretty sure you've heard this. "You are meant to do more than pay bills and die."

How about becoming apart of something greater? We are a rapidly growing community of successful local Real Estate investors who are securing the benefits of a once in a life time Buyers market. We are making changes now that will ensure a stress free future not just for ourselves, but for our loved ones.

Right here and now we are in a unique Real Estate buyers market which is fueling the rapid growth of our community of investors. With the intermingling of record low mortgage rates and lowered housing prices, our group is slaying in this market. You can look it up, the "world's greatest Investor" Warren Buffet is advising people to invest in real estate. At our investors gathering we discuss not only why, but how there are more millionaires created through real estate than any other industry.

At this local community meeting you will have the opportunity to:

*Network with a local group of successful Real Estate Investors.

*Discuss the biggest money making opportunities in today's market: Lease Options, Fix and Flips, Foreclosures, Seller Financed Notes, Wholesaling, Short Sales, Multi-Family Dwellings and far more.

*Learn how rental properties are one of the best tax redeemable strategies out there.

*Get mentored and coached by the best in the industry.

*Learn how to fire your boss within the next six to eight months.

*Find out how you can EARN substantial income while you LEARN Real Estate Investing.

*And so much more.

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $10 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

results.description:
Learn JavaScript Fundamentals w/ In-Person Instruction!

Fullstack's JavaScript Jumpstart is a two-week night course that teaches the "ABCs" of programming and JavaScript.

WHO IS THIS COURSE FOR? 

It's designed for students with little programming experience who want to get a "jumpstart" on their journey toward becoming a Fullstack developer. This course is also a great way to prepare for Fullstack Academy's admissions interviews. 

HOW IS THE COURSE STRUCTURED? WHAT IS THE SCHEDULE? 

The course will run over 3 evenings in two weeks. The three sessions will cover JavaScript fundamentals. Each concept will be covered by a practical hands-on workshop. You'll develop core programming skills and use them to build a cool final project, which will be created remotely after the 3rd class.  There will also be remote work to be completed during a portion of the off-nights.

HOW SHOULD I PREPARE FOR JUMPSTART?

All students will need to complete the first 5 units of codecademy.com's JavaScript track (approximately 4-5 hours) before the first class.  Students are also required to bring their own laptop - either Mac or Windows is fine.

IS JAVASCRIPT JUMPSTART AN IN-PERSON OR REMOTE CLASS?

ADVISORY: THERE WILL BE NO REMOTE OPTION FOR THE MID-NOVEMBER JUMPSTART CLASS

Live/In-Person - Jumpstart is taught at Fullstack Academy's campus in downtown NYC. Choose this option to attend all 3 evenings in-person, get in-person instruction and TA assistance, and see the Fullstack campus.

HOW MUCH DOES THE COURSE COST?

Tuition for this course is $295

HOW CAN I REGISTER? 

You must register through Eventbrite to secure a spot in the class. Head to the link below to signup for the class. Exclusively for our Meetup group members - Use the coupon code "jsmeetup" to take 15% off the price!

**Event Signup Link: http://mid-november-jumpstart.eventbrite.com**

** More Info:JSNP Class Details** 


Class space is limited, sign up today to secure your spot!

Course Schedule: 6:45pm - 9:15pm, All Classes

Day 1: Thursday Nov. 12, 2015

Day 2: Tuesday Nov. 17, 2015

Day 3: Thursday  Nov. 19, 2015
results.name: JavaScript Jumpstart Mid-November 2015

results.description:
New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to the study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions. 

The on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a study of the Tree of Life,  Alchemy and the Tarot, as well as the History of the Tarot. 

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class.

There will be a Meet-Up sign on the table.

Payment can be made in class.

results.description:
Where are you now and where do you want to be? 

What reality are you currently living in all aspects of your life - your Family & Friends, Finances, Faith, Fitness - and what reality do you WANT to be living? 

Perhaps this question isn’t new to you & you’ve started the journey of “Bridging the Gap,” only to experience that after all the mediations, NLP re-programming, affirmations, and visualizations (while they most definitely served you)… nothing has changed. 

WHY? What are you “missing”?


There's a reason you're not seeing many changes or why the changes are taking so long... but now there's an accelerated way to bridge the gap.   

It’s time to learn how. 

Join us this coming Thursday @7:00 pm for the answer to what you’ve been looking for… the exact tools and techniques that are “the missing piece” to your accelerated growth. 

We’re not going to “talk” about your transformation, you’re going to experience a transformation. 

Are you ready?

To Our Collective Success & With All My Love,
Talia 

**Please note: There is a $10 suggested donation to cover the cost of studio rental. Thank you! **
results.name: Bridging the Gap... Today!

results.description:
TICKETS ON OUR SITE

---------------------------------------

Please note that you must have a ticket from Eventbrite (purchased through our site) to attend.

RSVP'ing on Meetup alone will not get you in.

Designing Conversations - SMS like it's 1995

Presented by David Boardman & Sera Koo, Designers @ IDEO</a>


Price: <a href="http://www.designersandgeeks.com/events/designing-conversations?utm_source=designingconversations_meetup&utm_medium=meetup&utm_campaign=meetup_nyc">$15 for early birds, $20 for regular


As Interaction Designers, our role is to set the stage for conversations and design tools that can enable communication between people, objects, environments, and information. SMS is often underestimated, but is a powerful tool for prototyping these conversations. From design research to hacked simulations of products and services, SMS is a simple tool that goes a long way.

In this session of Designers + Geeks, we'll cover the spectrum of building conversations with users at different stages of the design process, and ways to start doing your own prototyping by leveraging IDEO case studies.

David Boardman is a Senior Design Lead at IDEO New York. He leads the Interaction Design discipline, and guides teams that design across multiple touch points to elevate people's experiences and create innovative new businesses. David has contributed to bringing several complex digital ecosystems to life in a broad set of industries including healthcare, the public sector, finance, and media.

Sera Koo is a Senior Interaction Designer at IDEO New York. Her work focuses on shaping the experience of users across digital products and services. As an expert in user experience, Sera's work has covered a range of topics including design strategy for digital platforms, UI design and best practices, and rapid prototyping.

Connect

We post discounts & freebies here:

Our Newsletter • Designers + Geeks Facebook • @DesignersGeeks


Satisfaction Guarantee

We organize this group to promote innovation, creativity, and the benefits of new technology. If you purchase a ticket and aren't happy with the experience, can't make it, or decide that you don't want to support the community for any reason, we're happy to refund your money.

Please note that if you do need to cancel your reservation, we request that you do so at least 24 hours before the event so that the tickets can be shared with others who may be waiting.
results.name: Designing Conversations - SMS like it's 1995

Cafe R, is on the south side of 32nd St, between 6th and 7th Ave. It is close to the A, C, E, 1, 2, 3, subways, Penn Station and the PATH. You'll find us in the Upstairs Section towards the 31st St entrance. We are the ones having the most fun. ^_^

results.description:
We're pleased to announce the venue for our next weekday happy hour, and it's going to be at one of Astoria's classiest LGBT-owned restaurant and bars.

Bear, owned by out and proud lesbian Natasha Pogrebinsky (also the executive chef!), is located in the up and coming southwest corner of Astoria, right near Socrates Sculpture Park. A pleasant stroll from all Queens/boro Plaza trains, the N/Q line 30th Avenue and Broadway stops, or the Q18/Q19/Q69/Q100/Q104 bus routes.

The venue is offering up an intimate extended happy hour with $5 beer, wine, and shots all evening. In addition, enjoy their fall-themed selection of signature drinks including a Maple-Rosemary Hot Toddy, Pumpkin Beer, Bear Bloody Mary, Honey & Thyme Cocktail, and more!

Order a la carte from their standard dinner menu, or the chef will be serving up a variety of bar nibbles at special prices for our group: $4 Deviled Eggs
$5 Burgers
$5 Polish Boy Mini Hot Dogs
$7 Savory Pies
$12 Bowl of Siberian Dumplings
$15 Bowl of Ukrainian Pierogies
$5 Desserts We'll also be hosting a raffle with a first prize of dinner for 2 with a cocktail pairing. All in an atmosphere replete with throw-back classic pop music and movies. Put this date on your calendar now, and step out for a fine evening at one of our favorite foodie hangouts.

NOTE: This venue is cash-only, so please remember to visit your favorite ATM on the way from the train.

http://bearnyc.com/

Let's participate in HVRW by going to this new seafood place in Mamaroneck.  Massa will welcome 6 of us at 7pm for a three course meal for 29.95 plus tax, tip, and drinks. Your $3 will secure your spot.  

Let our Italian heritage and food expertise meet your taste buds here at Massa’ Coastal Italian Cuisine where a wide variety of fresh whole fish and shellfish flown in from Italy, Greece, Spain, Portugal are prepared to perfection and your delight. We incorporate our American culture on our menu with American seafood varieties as well. Whether you prefer Italian sea bass, also known as Branzino, from the Mediterranean, East and West Coast oysters, manila clams, Maine lobster, or Bigeye tuna, we provide endless options and tasty results.

here's the menu: 

Antipasti Crudo del Mercato 

A selection from today’s raw seafood 

Calamari Alla Griglia Grilled with lemon and parsley 

Carciofi Brasati Duo of braised and fried artichoke hearts, bread crumbs, grana, herbs 

Arugula With sliced Bosc pear, walnuts, Roquefort, Balsamic mustard vinaigrette 

Burrata Creamy Mozzarella, served with Prosciutto di Parma, arugula and red and yellow cherry tomatoes 

 Secondi 

Whole Fish & Shellfish (Simply grilled or oven roasted with your choice of sauce and served over spinach) All specialties of the sea are hand picked by Chef Francesco. We feature a selection of fresh Mediterranean fish flown in from Italy, Greece, Spain, Portugal, as well as American varieties. Please ask your server for the selection of the day

Linguini Manila clams, garlic and oil

Deconstructed Cannoli Cannoli chips served with classic cannoli cream
