results.description:
It's not easy being a food innovator. There's no road map for reinventing an industry. So, in partnership with Force Brands: FoodForce | BevForce, we cooked up the Fail Friday series to celebrate failure in all its glory. 

At our fifth installment of Fail Friday, we'll hear from Farmigo, Lawless Jerky, Hungryroot and more. Startups will share their stories of failure and lessons learned from growing their businesses, followed by audience Q&A. 

There will be lots of snacks from Better Beast, Red Velvet, ProTings and Mama O's and Farmigo and drinks from Innis & Gunn and Slow and Low whiskey, plus lots of networking. 

SCHEDULE:

7:00 - 7:45: Networking, Snacks & Drinks 

7:45 - 8:45: Failure Stories & Q&A

8:45 - 9:30: More Networking

CONFIRMED SPEAKERS


Gigi Lee Chang - founder, Plum Organics - Gigi was most recently the CEO of Healthy Child Healthy World, a national non-profit whose mission is to educate parents to make chemical and toxin-free choices for their families.  She is a frequent speaker on various topics, including children’s health, food and nutrition. She was awarded “Brand Innovator 2008” and “2010” by Brand Packaging for Plum Organics.  Gigi is also an expert on socially conscious/sustainable business practices and entrepreneurship. She was an advisor to B Lab and is currently working on her next venture.


Lauren Jupiter - managing partner, AccelFoods - AccelFoods is an early-stage investment platform for packaged food companies committed to creating outsized returns for founders and investors through an operating team, network and impact capital. Lauren is a member of the Investment Committee and is responsible for supervising financial strategy for its entrepreneurs. Lauren also oversees the daily financial operations of AccelFoods. Lauren serves as a Board Member of Exo and Kalot. Lauren holds an A.B., cum laude in field, from Harvard College and an M.B.A. with Honors in Finance and Strategic Management from The Wharton School of Business.


Matt Tolnick - founder, Lawless Jerky -Formerly an attorney, Matt Tolnick realized that he could bring more smiles to more faces through his jerky than through his lawyering. So Matt bravely left his practice to pursue his passion: crafting small-batch jerky by hand and in powerful and unique Braver Flavors.   All flavors are thoughtfully handmade with consciously raised meats, including 100% grass-fed beef and hormone-free, antibiotic-free pork. 

Benzi Ronen - founder & CEO, Farmigo - Farmigo is actively rewiring the food system by putting the food experience back at its center. After spending two decades working in the technology industry, Benzi took a step back and reflected on his personal history, steeped in the importance of community. He thought about how technology has tremendous power to bring people together, and yet to date in the food industry, it has largely removed human connections entirely. He decided to focus his next, and most personal venture yet, on using technology to transform the suburban food system, which had become efficient, yet unsustainable and impersonal. Benzi is now founder and CEO of Farmigo, a company that makes local, farm-to-table food easily available, by bringing people together in neighborhoods across America.


Ben McKean - founder and CEO, Hungryroot - Hungryroot makes fresh, feel good convenience foods. Prior to Hungryroot, Ben was a Vice President and General Manager at Groupon, overseeing their food and beverage business. Ben came to Groupon through the acquisition of Savored, which he founded in 2009. Savored was the nation’s leading provider of yield management technology to the restaurant industry. Prior to Savored, Ben worked in Merrill Lynch’s technology investment banking group. Ben is graduate of Georgetown University and currently lives in New York City.
results.name: Fail Friday (On A Thursday): Food Startups Share Lessons Learned

Experienced runners and TMIRCE veterans, (pretty please) back away. This is for new runners only to get a taste of the sport we all love/hate so much. Although you'll get the most benefit by attending all six runs, you'll fit right in if you hop in during the middle of the program.

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

Vegan Drinks November 2015! 


Thursday, November 12, 2015. 7pm-9pm.
Benefits Chilis on Wheels.


Food also by Chilis on Wheels!

They'll be serving: 

• delicious vegan chili!!

About Chilis on Wheels. Chilis on Wheels was started on November, 2014 by Michelle Carrera. After searching for a soup kitchen that would serve a vegan Thanksgiving meal and coming up empty, she decided to cook her own chilis and take them directly to people in need of a warm meal. After receiving a lot of support and encouragement from family and friends, and after seeing first hand the need for such a program, she became inspired and committed to bringing vegan food to those in need.

Chilis are distributed once a week to people in the street that want a warm homecooked meal. Most soup kitchens close their doors over the weekends, creating a vaccum in services. Chilis on Wheels aims to cover that need and act as a bridge.
results.name: Vegan Drinks Brooklyn

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

Roger a écrit pour te prévenir que les membres de Meetup sont invité à un "Mini" French Film Festival à la bibliothèque de Westwood. R6ger et Pauline et présenterons deux films Basé sur les célèbres pièces de theatre de Marcel Pagnol, Marius (juedi le 12 novembre et Fanny (le 19 novembre).

Message Roger a le site Meetup si vous avez des questions.

Fanny is a 1932 French romance and drama film, directed by Marc Allégret based on the play by Marcel Pagnol. It is the second part in the Marseillaise film trilogy that started with Marius (1931) and concluded with César (1936). Like "Marius" the film was a box office success in France and today is still considered to be a classic of French cinema.

results.description:
"Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Today, our membership is 260,000 strong. These members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 12,500-plus clubs that make up our global network of meeting locations.

How Does It Work?

A Toastmasters meeting is a learn-by-doing workshop in which participants hone their speaking and leadership skills in a friendly atmosphere. A typical group has 20 to 40 members who meet weekly, biweekly or monthly. A typical meeting lasts 60 – 90 minutes.There is no instructor in a Toastmasters meeting. Instead, members evaluate one another’s presentations. This feedback process is a key part of the program’s success. Meeting participants also give impromptu talks on assigned topics, conduct meetings and develop skills related to timekeeping, grammar and parliamentary procedure."

Why should I join?
The Toastmasters program offers many benefits that help people in all walks of life. As a result of participating in Toastmasters, you will:

Increase your self-confidenceBecome a better speakerBecome a better leaderCommunicate more effectively

Membership is affordable – a great value that can change your life that costs less than a dollar a day. Your initial investment:

$20 New member fee $36 Dues for six months, plus any club expenses. (Some clubs may charge a nominal fee in addition to the regular dues for items such as meeting space and club supplies.)

More than 4 million people have discovered the benefits of this proven learning formula. What are you waiting for?
results.how_to_find_us: http://966830.toastmastersclubs.org/
results.name: Carpe Diem Toastmasters International

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.
results.name: Live Model Drawing - Union Square

results.description:
Introduction


This event is part of the HVH Film Screening Series! Reel Rock 10 Film Screening comes to the Darress Theatre in Boonton NJ. This is a must attend event for those Hudson Valley Hikers interested in film festivals, rock climbing, etc. For those that plan to arrive early, we can meet at a local bar/restaurant for dinner!


Details


How far will you go to chase your passions? Reel Rock 10 is a series of 5 films that answers the question and more with their showcase of the best climbing and adventure films of the year. Follow professional athletes as they challenge their fears, the land, and elements in pursuit of their dreams.

In its landmark 10th year, REEL ROCK features exclusive premieres of short films by REEL ROCK co-founders Sender Films and Big UP Productions that tell the stories of the most exciting vertical action from the past year. From big walls to big moves, and featuring athletes Tommy Caldwell, Kevin Jorgeson, Alex Honnold, Ashima Shiraishi, Daniel Woods and more, this year's tour boasts an eclectic program that will get you psyched!

A few additional details concerning this event:

• Doors open at 7:00PM, Film starts at 7:30PM.

• Tickets are $15 in advance, or $20 day of show (subject to availability).

• Giveaways throughout the night from such sponsors as Time to Climb, NJ Rock Gym, Walkabout Mountain Guides, and PCL Solutions.


References

• Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/434380966747401/

• Brown Paper Tickets: http://reelrock.brownpapertickets.com/

• Trailer: https://youtu.be/mXNOTJFEBsQ

• Time to Climb: www.TimetoClimb.com

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers. 

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.

results.description:
This is an open Circle for all members.

This weekly session is to build upon the skills that you learned in our workshops. We get to practice and go into greater depth.

While many of my groups are run with a go with the flow attitude, this will:

• Begin and end on time

• 10 min opening meditation

• Cleansing

• A 10 min of discussion/question answer

• And 60 min of hands on application

• 10 min of closing

• We will begin promptly at 7:30 and end at 9:00

We will review and proceed to build on your existing knowledge and move together into new topics of exploration.

Your intuition requires practice and dedication to fully open and control. Should this group grow and demonstrate the need for more frequent gatherings, we will implement a schedule that meets on a more frequent basis.

results.description:
Thursday, November 12, 7:30 - 9:00 pm

Do you find it difficult at times to "do the dating thing" in New York?

Want to hear what other singles find challenging, and strategies they have for handling those challenges?

Dane Colon, facilitator of the NY Men's Group "No More Mr. Nice Guy," and Melanie Rubin, author of the book "What Women Really Want from Men: A Step-by-Step Dating Manual," are facilitating a free discussion group to brainstorm dating challenges and solutions.

Note that the facilitators will give an overview at the beginning of the discussion that provides a structure for all to introduce themselves, speak and be heard during the meeting.

WHO THIS IS FOR: Men and women 20s and on up who are single, respectful, and wanting to enjoy a good discussion. People of different ages learn from each others' experiences.

WHAT THIS IS: An opportunity to meet other singles, enjoy a frank conversation, with depth and structure that allows all to speak, and find positive solutions.

WHAT THIS IS NOT: A pickup session or a bitch session.

WHERE: 875 Third Avenue, between 52nd and 53rd Streets

WHEN: Thursday, Noember 12, starting at 7:30 pm and ending around 9 pm

COST: Free!

HOW TO FIND US: This is an atrium building. Enter off third avenue and take the escalator to the second level. We will be sitting at a group of tables overlooking the atrium.

TRANSPORTATION: The 4, 6, E, and M lines of the subway all go to the 51st - 53rd and Lexington street station of the subway.

ABOUT EVENTS WITH DANE AND MELANIE:

"Working with Melanie was an excellent experience." —Linda

"If you are remotely curious about one of Melanie’s events, go for it! They are definitely worth it. " —Peter

"Melanie is a great facilitator with deep understanding of people’s behavior, and respect for everyone." —Raquel

"Dane is a force multiplier – creating growth by inspiring you to believe you are fully capable of it youself." —Ray

"Dane’s advice is thought-out and timely. It’s based on his own experience, so it resonates with others." —David

NEED MORE INFORMATION? Email [masked]

results.description:
Hi Kiwi Club meetup members! This meetup event is just a placeholder. We hold regular monthly drinks nights on the second Thursday of each month at a bar around Manhattan. (We don't use the Meetup.com site to schedule these, as it's too inflexible for us, and has a habit of scheduling next month's meetup at the same venue as last month's, which isn't how we operate.) Go to the Kiwi Club's own website, www.kiwiclubny.org, for full details of all drinks night locations, as well as our other events!

The annual BBQ picnic in the summer, which is usually on the Sunday a week before Labor day. This year will be August 30th, 2015. This is a massive event with barbecued sausages and lamb. Games for the kids like sack races, egg and spoon and three-legged race, a gumboot throwing competition and a tug-of-war between the North and South islands, and a lolly scramble for the kids at the end.

We have a Christmas party in December (usually the first or second Saturday), and a number of other events besides. Please go to http://www.kiwiclubny... for more details, or email [masked]. And you can follow us on Facebook and Twitter (@KiwiClubNY)

You can join the Kiwi Club of NY online at http://kiwiclubny.org/amember/signup.php The membership cost is very reasonable and entitles you to members only prices for the summer picnic, the Christmas party in December, and other events during the year.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
A group of professional designers, programmers and bloggers meets in Fair Lawn monthly. Come to a meeting and help shape the discussion. There's room for all interests and levels of web, design or technology involvement. Discussions take on shape according to who shows up any particular month. We meet at Panera Bread to take advantage of the free Wifi and the great onion soup! Bring your iphone or laptop and feel free to bring a friend!

Looking forward to seeing you at a meeting soon!

Kimi Wei thewei.com
Contact me via Meetup organizer link.

Meeting Attendance Fees No fee for web and technology professionals. Individuals NOT web or technology professionals pay an attendance fee of $10. FAQ about this policy. Employment agents and direct employers:
Company agents looking to hire and headhunters may attend a meeting for up to 30 minutes without paying a fee. This should give you time to assess member's interest in networking with you and to hand out cards. If you would like to make a presentation or sponsor the group for a meeting or series of meetings please contact me. New or existing company looking for freelancers or wanting site critiques
For a $50 fee you may attend a meeting and interact casually with group members for about an hour, but you may not solicit targeted advice about your project or website at that meeting. If you want the group to provide a site critique, or you need help with solutions for your site/project please contact me to set up a brainstorming session. Cost will be discussed at that time.

results.description:
Join us as we discuss the novel The Invention of Wings by Sue Monk Kidd.

Inspired by the true story of early-nineteenth-century abolitionist and suffragist Sarah Grimke, Kidd paints a moving portrait of two women inextricably linked by the horrors of slavery. Sarah, daughter of a wealthy South Carolina plantation owner, exhibits an independent spirit and strong belief in the equality of all. Thwarted from her dreams of becoming a lawyer, she struggles throughout life to find an outlet for her convictions. Handful, a slave in the Grimke household, displays a sharp intellect and brave, rebellious disposition. She maintains a compliant exterior, while planning for a brighter future.


Novels at Night is  a book club for adults 21 years and older who enjoy reading and sharing their opinions about books. Join us monthly at the 9 Iron Grille (314 Paramus Road) to meet new people, sample great food** and drinks, and discuss books in a relaxed atmosphere.  Copies of this novel can be picked up at the Paramus Public Library (116 East Century Road). Please feel free to call the library with any questions about this program, (201) 599-1305.
results.name: The Invention of Wings by Sue Monk Kidd

Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

*Texas hold 'em (also known as Texas holdem, hold 'em, or holdem) is a variation of the standard card game of poker. Two cards (hole cards) are dealt face down to each player and then five community cards are placed face-up by the dealer—a series of three ("the flop") then an additional single card ("the turn" or "fourth street") and another additional card ("the river" or "fifth street"). The best five card poker hand is obtained by taking cards from either the community or their hole cards. Players have the option to check, bet, raise or fold after each deal; i.e., betting may occur prior to the flop, "on the flop", "on the turn", and "on the river".

results.description:
Jambo! On 11/12/15, come and hear Kathi Scott speak about adventure and leisure travel to Africa: safaris, wine, hiking and cultural tours. Kathi has over 40 years experience in the travel industry, specializing in Africa.

Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!

results.description:
We are women who OM (OM stands for Orgasmic Meditation), and we want to tell you our stories.
(An Event for Women Only)

Charged. Vulnerable. Heated. Curious. Electric.

What happened throughout our lives - how we felt the timbres of our bones shaking and that undeniable yearning to know ourselves in this world more deeply. To push ourselves further, to love ourselves more; to live what we now know to be an Orgasmic Life. Orgasm. Power. Connection. Sex. Desire. Purpose.

We were touched by something wordless and visceral, impossible to explain, but harder to avoid. We argued with everything we’d ever been told about how our bodies should look, how much happiness we were allowed, how our relationships were supposed to go; we worked with our minds just enough to get bodies on the mat to feel that first stroke. And from that moment, everything changed. That smallest whisper that started out as “despite the fear, i want this” became “i can have it, because it’s my birthright”. That is how we live our lives; on the edge of believing, beyond what 99% of the what the world thinks is possible in the realm of sexuality, spirituality, business and relationship. We are people that would not otherwise meet; from bankers to dancers to electricians to actors to teachers to entrepreneurs. But we all want one thing; to make this world better, more intimate, and to put the passion inside of us to better use.

Join the New York women of the OM community for an evening of their journey into Orgasmic Meditation. For more information contact Margot[masked]
results.name: The Women who OM Series (An Event for Women Only)

results.description:
EVERY 2nd Thursday of the month!

The Inspired Word Presents We Heart NYC Writers Night + Open Mic atThe Parkside Lounge, one of the coolest performance spots in Manhattan's East Village.

This is a celebration of emerging New York City writers of all types - poets, novelists, journalists, short story writers. Shows feature carefully selected writers who have recently released books as well as a 15-slot open mic (5-minute time limit).

Signed books will be available for purchase - a great chance to show local literary love.

Please share this event on social networks with the hashtags #SupportLocalWritersNYC #BuyBooksNYC #SupportEmergingWritersNYC. It's good karma.

A percentage of the proceeds - and 100% of the #SupportLocalWritersNYC DONATIONS - go to the featured writers.


***21+ age limit (please make sure to bring valid ID)***

*****
When: EVERY 2nd Thursday of the month

Where: The Parkside Lounge
317 East Houston Street (between Stanton and Clinton Streets)
Manhattan, NY 10002

By subway, take the F to 2nd Avenue, walk up the 1st Avenue stairway, then walk east.

Doors open for open mic sign-up @ 7:45pm. Slots will be given out on a first come, first serve basis.

Band goes on @ 8pm. Feature show begins @ 8:30. 

*****

Purchase advance tickets @ <a>https://weheartnycwritersopenmic.eventbrite.com.</a>;

Cover Charge: $6 online (which allows you to bring an audience friend for free), $7 at the door.

***2 Drink Minimum (but drinks are super cheap and $2 non-alcoholic options are available)***

*****


Produced by Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word
http://inspiredwordnyc.com

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change.

Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."

results.description:
Join us if you'd like to be featured!

Featuring:

Try The World was co-founded in 2013 by Kat Vorotova and David Foult. Try The World works with local experts and celebrity chefs to source the best food from each country, and make these hard-to-find products available in Try The World’s subscription boxes and online shop. They have imported over 1 million gourmet products since launch.

Kat Vorotova is a New York-based passionate food-lover, born in Russia. Kat has worked for a global food company as a strategy consultant and ran a food blog and dining club in New York City prior to attending Columbia Business School.

David Foult is a globetrotter who grew up in Paris, France and moved to New York in 2012 to pursue his MPA at Columbia University’s School of International and Public Affairs. In France David did an MBA and was involved with several start-ups. David's appreciation for local craftsmanship led him to start a microcredit company in Vietnam, which helped artisans and farmers in the city of Hue finance their local projects.

Village Tech Breakfast:

We'll do a round of introductions, followed by another round of questions for our featured guest. It's fun fast and interactive. Then we'll stay and chat as long as people like.

Recommended:

• Learn how Metric Insights can help you revolutionize team communication about the KPIs that matter to you. 

• Learn how to connect Metric Insights straight onto your existing Tableau dashboards to pull multiple dashboards all into one place.

• Learn how to set up alerting straight to your email, phone or wearable so that you know exactly what's going on in your business. 

Still not sure? For existing Metric Insight customers, this course is $1000 but if you are yet to buy Metric Insights, BIPB is offering this training course FREE! 

We have a strict limit to the number of places we can offer on this course so sign up now and fill out the sign up information fully so that we can contact you to confirm your place. 

See you soon, 

The BIPB Team

results.description:
We need your help to make this massive and to help a lot of people.

Help us kick- off Hunger & Homelessness Awareness week (November 14th – 22nd) with a massive Neighborhood Food Drive to help feed those in need this holiday season.

This meetup allows you to volunteer alone, or to recruit up to 5 friends to help and multiply your impact.

Step 1: As a volunteer team leader you will be able to pick up to 5 re-usable shopping bags from Volunteer New York! starting November 13th.

Step 2: During November (13th through the 20th), you will find up to 4-5 volunteers to each go shopping (or collect donations) to fill these bags with non-perishable food items from the list  of suggested items that will be provided.

Step 3: Collect all 5 bags filled with items to donate.

Step 4: As volunteer team leader you will be given a designated food pantry where all your donations should be dropped off.

Sound simple enough? If you have questions please contact Judy at[masked]-9315.

This meetup will directly support individuals living throughout Westchester and Rockland, NY.

Find out more about what we're doing for Hunger & Homelessness Awareness week at http://www.volunteernewyork.org/hungerweek

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change

results.description:
Hello Friends

We apologize but due to a scheduling conflict, Aanarav had to cancel. However, we are just as excited to have Angelia Muller come by and share!

Angelia serves as the Director of XRC Labs, a stage-agnostic accelerator for the next generation of disruptors in the retail and consumer goods sectors. Previously, she founded Inspir.nation, a marketing and consulting service for startups in the SF Bay Area. She was the first entrepreneur in residence at GA San Francisco, and is an organizer of Startup Weekend NYC.


Prior to joining XRC, Angelia was also the program manager of New Client Acquisition at IBM, where she led millennial engagement for IBM Commerce. In her free time, Angelia works on off-the-grid connected micro-homes.


We'll get a chance to hear about her journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!

In Good Company

results.description:
We're still working our way through Kit Eason's F# Functional Data Structures class. We have 1.5 hours scheduled and will be able to make it through the next two modules -- Sequences and Lists, listed below -- plus have some discussion afterwards!

Description

F# is a .NET (CLI) language. It combines functional and OO (Object Oriented) concepts to you let you solve complex problems with simple code. F# is surprisingly easy to learn. This course covers all the fundamentals, and is suitable for anyone with basic software development experience.

About Kit

Kit is a senior software developer for an energy trading systems provider. He has also developed software for automotive engineering companies, universities, energy suppliers, banks, and financial services companies. Kit has run many educational and training courses, including evening classes, women's electronics classes and CNC training for engineers. Kit is a regular speaker at SkillsMatter in London, and at various conferences and meetups. He works mainly in F# and C# and normally speaks on F# and related matters.

Sequences 49:35

Introduction  0:57

Creating Sequences  3:52

Using Seq.unfold  6:54

Collections as Sequences  1:48

More on Sequence Expressions  5:54

Accessing Sequence Elements  3:24

Searching Within Sequences  8:48

Grouping Sequences  7:14

Seq.pairwise, Seq.windowed and Seq.collect  7:21

Sequences: The Tradeoffs  2:08

Summary  1:08

Lists 12:07

Introduction  1:30

Creating Lists  2:10

Accessing List Elements  2:29

The List Module  1:02

List Mutability  1:33

Combining Lists  1:10

Performance of List Operations  1:11

Summary  0:59
results.how_to_find_us: Enter from the River St. entrance, and security will send you up. We're on the 8th floor. Once you get in the office, reception will guide you to the room.

• This site is currently under construction. Please dress appropriately.  Guests will be required to sign a waiver upon arrival. Thanks! 
• This site is not open to children. Children will be permitted to wait outside with an accompanying adult. 


PROPERTY INFO: 
• Great news! This project's PHPP recently passed its review by the Passive House Academy (PHA), and as long as the required air tightness goal is reached, this project has been approved to be a certified EnerPhit project.  

• 90% of the building's mechanicals have already been installed, including most of the ERV components.  However the drywall has not been installed yet, making this project a great opportunity for people to see what makes a passive house project different.

• A sample Optiwin window will be available onsite, similar to the ones which will be installed at the site in January.

results.description:
Hi all,

I hope you are enjoying a lovely fall. And before the Holiday Season takes over, let's meet to share a tasty meal and good conversation.

We have a lot of new members who have signed up over the last months. Please let me welcome you and encourage you to join us on November 13 at 1pm.


Our meetings are always on a Friday at 1pm at a local Park Slope restaurant. Sometimes they are 4 weeks apart, other times 5 or 6 weeks. It depends on general timing and holiday schedules. But since I took over several years ago we do meet between 8-10 times a year - a tradition that many enjoy.


Looking forward to meeting our new members and seeing those who have come before,

Renate

PS: When you RSVP "Yes" but can't make it after all, PLEASE change your status immediately! I need to let restaurants know exactly how many people to expect AND those who come need to order at a reasonable time. Waiting for people who never show up puts me in a difficult position. Thank you for your consideration.

PPS: To offset the recently increased fee meetup.com charges for its services, I will collect $3 from each participant after the meal. Thank you!

Village Natural is described as a low-key vegetarian and vegan-friendly, with some fish dishes.  It has been drawing locals for nearly two decades in the same spot.  Only organic produce is used, organic beers and wines are on hand, and fruit shakes and healthy teas round out an all-natural feast. They have an extensive and tempting menu. About half the menu is vegan.  They serve both dairy and vegan cheeses.  People rave about their veggie burgers, and there's also a grilled salmon burger. 


Soy Chicken Kiev stuffed with rice, vegetables and herbs. 


Grilled Salmon Burger

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

results.description:
Sicilian Marionettes with Tony De Nonno Featured Event

Friday, November 13,[masked]:30 pm – 4:30 pm
Park Slope Library

(Tony De Nonno holding marionette)


Papa Manteo puppeteers
Award-winning TV producer/writer/director and historian Tony De Nonno will take audience members on an enlightening journey into the life and legacy of puppeteers Mike and Aida Manteo, their children, and even grandchildren -- a family bound together by a Sicilian folk tradition that spans a century in New York. Come experience this enchanting vision of New York's acclaimed Papa Manteo Sicilian Marionette Theater, first established on Catherine Street in Manhattan's Little Italy in 1918.

During this program Mr. De Nonno will encourage "children of all ages" to interact directly with one of Papa Manteo's marionettes.

A highlight of the program will be the screening of Mr. De Nonno's award-winning PBS documentary about the Manteos: "It's One Family: Knock on Wood"

This program is for all ages!

Age Group: All Ages
This program has been generously sponsored by the Friends Of Park Slope Library.

New York History Puppetry
Where
Park Slope Library
431 6th Ave. at 9th St.
Brooklyn, NY 11215

results.description:
OPEN HOUSE DATES/TIMES: 
• Fri. Nov. 13th from 4 pm - 6 pm
• Sat. Nov. 14th from 11 am - 4 pm


SITE CONTACT: 
• Monika Parkitna 

SITE INFORMATION: 
• 'Passive House' inspired renovation -- This two-bedroom ‘ranch style’ house was completely renovated. The footprint of the house was kept in its original form, and the second floor was added on.  Sustainability and energy efficiency were the main guiding ideas behind the project. Conditioned Area: 2,270 sf

• The house provides excellent levels of thermal protection and an airtight building envelope. The new building systems include: enthalpy recovery ventilation system,  split system heat pump, and a photovoltaic system. 

• The existing exterior walls were built-up to double stud walls achieving combined R- 33 value. The new main roof, a vented mono truss roof, got insulated with blown in cellulose insulation for R -60. The existing first floor joists were insulated to R-58. The new roof over one story structure was also insulated to R-58. The existing basement walls were internally insulated achieving R 23. 

• Taping and sealing of the new plywood sheathing was performed. The double stud wall features a smart vapor retarder installed below the new 2x3 wall. 

• Triple-paned windows were installed. 

• The new heating/cooling system is a Split System Heat Pump with two internal air handlers distributing conditioned air through ducts. Auxiliary heating, for extremely low temperatures, is provided by means of electrical baseboards. 

• The fresh air is delivered by ERV. Exhaust boosters are installed at all bathrooms and kitchen ducts. An recirculating fan is provided at the kitchen stove.


PROJECT TEAM: 
• Architect: Monika Parkitna, RA
• Structural Engineer: Allan Klein, PE
• General Contractor: Zdzislaw Dziegiel and MS Brothers

results.description:
STAR WARS™ AND THE POWER OF COSTUME
THE EXHIBITION

Are you a fan of STAR WARS?  Are your children?  This is sure to be an amazing opportunity for the dads in the group to experience "Star Wars and the Power of Costume" with their children at Discovery Times Square.

We cannot for Star Wars: the Force Awakens to be released later this year so this should be a perfect experience to do together as a featured dads group meet up event as we gear up for the film....for FREE!

Important Event Details: Please read carefully* We only have 40 spots so when you RSVP, please include # of children you are taking that are age 3 and over in the RSVP (2 and under are free so won't require a ticket)


* FREE admission for DAD + children

* Kids 2 and under will not require a spot - they don't need a ticket & are free.

* These are timed tickets so we'll meet promptly at 3:50pm for our 4pm tix

* This opportunity is exclusively for NYC Dads Group members and their children only. (sorry, we won't have enough tix for our wives, extended family, or friends)

* This meet up event will most likely fill up so please, only RSVP if you are serious about attending. In your RSVP comments, please include # of children you are taking and ages

* Strollers are not allowed in exhibit (they will have to be checked near front) so please plan accordingly


About the Exhibit:

STAR WARS™ AND THE POWER OF COSTUME
THE EXHIBITION Featuring 70 hand-crafted costumes from the first six blockbuster Star Wars films, this exhibition reveals the artists’ creative process—and uncovers the connection between character and costume. George Lucas imagined and created a fantastical world filled with dynamic characters who told the timeless story of the hero’s journey. The costumes shaped the identities of these now famous characters, from the menacing black mask of Darth Vader and the gilded suit of C-3PO, to the lavish royal gowns of Queen Amidala and a bikini worn by Princess Leia when enslaved by Jabba the Hutt. A special presentation for the showing at Discovery Times Square in New York will feature seven additional costumes from the highly anticipated film, Star Wars: The Force Awakens.

Discovery Times Square (DTS) is New York City's first large-scale exhibition center presenting visitors with limited-run, educational and immersive exhibit experiences while exploring the world's defining cultures, art, history and events. More than a museum, DTS has featured exhibitions of unparalleled breadth, including Titanic: The Artifact Exhibition, Leonardo Da Vinci's Workshop, King Tut, Pompeii The Exhibit, Dead Sea Scrolls: The Exhibition and most recently Terracotta Warriors: Defenders of China’s First Emperor. DTS is located at 226 West 44th Street (between Broadway and 8th Avenues).


ACCOMMODATIONS

Discovery Times Square is wheelchair accessible.

Complimentary bag checks are available to safely store strollers, backpacks, shopping bags or large bags, which are not permitted inside the galleries pending space availability.

For more information on the exhibit at Discovery Times Square please visit http://www.discoverytsx.com/exhibitions/avengers

About  Byte Academy:

Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python.  Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology).  Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program - recently declared as the highest paid programming language - and the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive a $2,000 off tuition. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay zero until they find a job. 

Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its December Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes 

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)

results.description:
Bring a significant object from your personal history collection and share its tale in 3 minutes or less at our first Show & Tale event to be held at WeWork!

Did you keep your first business card? Or that napkin with the first notes about the business you have/are creating? Do you have a favorite spoon(s), mug, pen, pair of boots? Do you have a “lucky” piece of clothing you wear on important dates? Have you kept cards, letters & thank you notes you read over and over that make you feel like pushing ahead? A favorite recipe you make when you’re feeling down or like celebrating? Aprons, clothing, kitchen gadgets, photos, paintings, jewelry, tools.... You get the picture. Every Thing has a story©.

Bring these & any other object that has a story to show and tell. Like Pinterest/Instagram/TBT but in person. Or Antiques Roadshow meets The Moth!

And remember you don't have to show & tell... you can just look & listen. And while you're at it check out the awesome new WeWork space in Brooklyn & share/learn about personal history.
results.name: Show & Tale: Artifacts & Totems

results.description:
Baxt Ingui Architects is excited to be hosting the New York Passive House kick-off event to celebrate the start of the 2015 International Passive House Days. 

The Kickoff Event will be held at a net-zero passive house being built by M2 Contracting, one of eight passive houses that Baxt Ingui has designed. A number of the passive products utilized will be on display. Demonstrations will take place throughout the day on Saturday, November 14 – details here.


This house is currently under construction, making it a great opportunity to see passive building in progress. Appropriate construction site attire suggested.

Drinks and hors d’oeuvres will be served.  

Come by with your colleagues to unwind and share stories.
results.name: Passive House Days Kick-Off Reception

group.name: NY Passive House (NYPH) Meetup: New York City

results.description:
Not one of our events, but one I think you'll really like--
Jeff Wiener's amazing online magazine The Great Nude is hosting this exhibition and drawing event:

A Celebration of Life Drawing November 12-15, 2015
An Exhibition of Figurative Artworks with Life Drawing Events
Jay Gould Townhouse • 179 Sullivan Street, New York, New York

Exhibiting: Sherry Camhy, Janet A. Cook, Leah Poller, John Wellington, Jeffrey Wiener

Join us for a weekend of art inspired by Life Drawing as five fabulous Figurative Artists present their artworks on several floors of a Landmark Greenwich Village Mansion. Organized by TheGreatNude in collaboration with the Art Alliance. This Figurative Arts event will include three days of Sketch Sessions, TheGreatNude’s life drawing events in which the public is invited to join Artists sketching from our life models.

(To Join a Sketch Session on Nov. 13, 14 or 15, please R.S.V.P. your name and email address to <a>[masked]</a> )

Friday, November 13th
• Exhibition – 1pm – 8pm
• Life Drawing – 5pm – 7pm

Saturday, November 14th
• Exhibition – 1pm – 8pm
• Life Drawing – 5pm – 7pm

Sunday, November 15th
• Exhibition – 1pm – 6pm
• Life Drawing – 2pm – 4pm
• Exhibition Closes – 6pm

LOCATION:
179 Sullivan Street was home to the industrialist Jay Gould, a scion of the Gilded Age; it is located 2 blocks from Washington Square in the heart of Greenwich Village.

HOSTS:
The Art Alliance
For 20 years the Art Alliance has provided services to the art world as a gallery, curator of international events, artists’ agent and arts activist. Directed by Leah Poller, the Art Alliance has curated more than 130 exhibitions. Its current activities include curatorial services, representation of China’s premier art casting foundry in the US, and select public speaking engagements and workshops.

TOWN Residential
TOWN Residential is New York’s leading luxury real estate services firm. Founded in 2010, TOWN Residential is an integral part of the New York real estate landscape. TOWN Residential specializes in luxury residential sales; leasing; and the marketing, sales and leasing of property developments.

TheGreatNude.tv
TheGreatNude was launched in 2007 by artist/entrepreneur Jeffrey Wiener as an online video magazine with a mission to become the “Figurative Arts Network”. By introducing a new generation of art-lovers to the traditional Figurative Arts, TheGreatNude has grown to become a popular arts magazine, with a loyal following of artists, curators, critics and collectors subscribed to their Social Media venues Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram and particularly YouTube with over 25,000 subscribers and over 19 million views.

TheGreatNude has produced numerous public and private art exhibitions and Life Drawing Events that offer the art-loving public a dynamic interaction with Fine Artists and their art works, in unique settings that are comfortable, insightful and educational.

The Great Nude, Inc.
435 East 79th Street, Suite #12P
New York, New York 10075

Jeffrey Wiener, Publisher
Email: <a>[masked]</a>
Phone:[masked]
YouTube.com/thegreatnude
Facebook.com/tgnmag
Twitter: @TheGreatNude
Instagram: @tgn.tv
results.name: The Great Nude -- A Celebration of Life Drawing November 12-15, 2015

OPEN HOUSE DATES/TIMES:  

• Fri. Nov. 13th from 5 pm - 9 pm - NYPH Open Houses Kickoff Event, held here at 16 3rd Place - Click for more info

• Sat. Nov. 14th from 11 am - 6 pm - Open House with Demonstrations 

Baxt Ingui is pleased to host NYPH on-site passive product and method workshops on Saturday November 14th during the Open House at 16 3rd Place. 

• 11:30am – Kevin Brennan of Passive House Academy and Max Michel of M2 Contracting Inc. will perform hands-on demonstrations of air sealing techniques, including details at party walls, front and rear walls, roof, and windows.

• 1:00pm – Ken Levenson of 475 High Performance Building Supply will describe a variety of products available for passive houses.

• 2:00pm – John Rockwell from Zehnder America will discuss the benefits of an ERV system and the recommended applications and installations.

• 3:00pm – Florian Speier from Zola European Windows will present the windows and doors being installed in this passive house.


SITE CONTACT: 
• Michael Ingui, Baxt Ingui Architects 

SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS: 
• This house is currently under construction, making it a great opportunity to see passive building in progress. Appropriate construction site attire suggested.

results.description:
This is the 1st part of the two-day program on Nov. 13 & Nov. 14 at the New York Historical Society (not sponsored by NYCIR).  The cryptic title is meant to avoid attracting attention and competition from outside the group. 


Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito and constitutional scholar Philip C. Bobbitt will give opening remarks before the screening of the 1959 courtroom classic Anatomy of a Murder.

No advanced reservations.   Entrance to the film is included with Museum Admission during Pay-as-you-wish Friday Nights (6–8 pm). Tickets are distributed on a first-come, first-served basis beginning at 6 pm. The program starts at 7pm.

Let’s get there by 5:30 pm to line up for the movie since admission is not guaranteed.  In case it’s sold out or you can’t go this evening, Amazon Video streams the movie for $2.99. 

http://www.nyhistory.org/programs/anatomy-murder-1959
results.how_to_find_us: Line up for the movie tickets.  Our Meetup Host Sheila will wear a name tag for recognition.

results.description:
This is a meet and greet meeting and an introduction to night photography where members will learn how to setup their cameras to take great holiday decoration and night festivities pictures.

It will be held in the Digital Merit Photography Studio in Astoria, Queens.


It is our first meeting and it is totally free.


Also in the meeting we will discuss the topics of interests to the the group members that they would like to discuss in future gatherings.


I intend to schedule one or two followup meetings in the field in the near future to put to practice the principles which will be learned in this meeting. Some places I have in mind are the Rockefeller Center in Manhattan, and Dyker Heights in Brooklyn.

Each member to bring a camera with him/her to the meeting. We will discuss cameras' capabilities for night photography and their limitations.


Refreshments will be provided.
results.name: Introduction to Night Photography.

Please come and celebrate St.Martins day with Emma and her parents.

We gonna walk around the Pier with our self crafted lanterns.

( look for the lantern crafting meetup in our calendar on Wed 11/11 )

And sing Martins songs. Like this:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6cV1o_JlgWY 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8AUl2_B9YwA 

This tradition goes back to St.Martin who shared his cloak with a beggar , by cutting it in half with his sword.If you want to learn more, please read here:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Martin%27s_Day 

We'll meet at the beginning of the Pier, walk to the end, make a 30min picture stop and then walk back.

Please support me with singing. I will have the songs printed out and count on your help ! ;-) 

In case of any questions, please contact me, Ina under[masked]

results.description:
Come join us as we celebrate Do Something Nyack!'s Past, Present and Future! 

Say Farewell to the Past Leaders: Michelle and Asha and get to know Dan, the new Organizer and the many New Event Organizers making Do Something Nyack! pretty fantastic: Daniela, Ray, Victoria, Brian, Candace, Abbie, Jennifer, Kate, Deb,....and many more to come! We can also discuss all the events we are excited to (hopefully) see in the next few months. 

So let's have a drink, laugh, (I might cry a little), and toast to cherished memories, amazing friendships and a deep appreciation for the town we all love!

Hey all, Meeting Friday 6-9:30pm at URBO in Times Sq. it's smack on the corner of 42nd and 8th... Happy Hour is from 5-7pm

I will be there at 6. We will be on the 1st floor at the tables near the bar. 

Check the page day of for updates on where we are sitting and how to find us.
My # is[masked] if you have trouble finding us. 

(As always group rules - we arrive, order, chat for a few then we write in timed intervals of 1 hour with no conversations, take a short break, then start up the timer again. We are not a group for sharing and critiquing each other's work, this group just focuses on getting writing done. However, sharing with each other is Never discouraged, but our sessions are not for group reading and discussing. Just so you are aware of what to expect.)
Hope to see you there.

results.description:
To volunteer for this event, fill out the survey linked below:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1aSjaF5VKbUFNHyO2_tZhW6dfpH3WdaUgY5aYRyWt0_E/viewform


Trevor NextGen NY is excited to present our annual Fall Fete!!This fundraiser celebrates 16 years of The Trevor Project, the leading national organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and questioning youth.


This year's Spring Fling was the largest event to date for Trevor NextGen NY and featured an exciting raffle and silent auction items, a full hosted bar, and live entertainment. 

And Spring Fling could not have been successful without our volunteers from 20Something. 

We hope to have the same success again with the Fall Fete!

Tickets on Sale now! 

http://TRVR.org/FallFete2015


Flash Sale: $65 (limited number available, 2 per purchase) -SOLD OUT

General Admission: $75

All-Star Access (Includes an extra 1.5 hours of open bar, a free gift, and more!): $130

Marquee Access (Includes 6 All-Star level tickets, a reserved table with bottle service, and more!): $1,250

FEATURING

DJ Tracy Young -Headlining DJ

Tracy Young is an international DJ and producer, in demand at nightclubs around the world and a breakout name on the Billboard charts. She has racked over 48 #1 Club Play hits including 13 Madonna remixes as well as imaginative electronic reinventions of songs by Christina Aguilera, Shakira, and Enrique Iglesias, Cher, Britney Spears, Katy Perry, Demi Lovato and Beyonce. She has released over 7 musical compilations on her own record label FEROSH, and remixed for over 100 musical artists. Through Madonna’s personal endorsement as her “go-to” DJ , Young has become a global electronic music celebrity. She has spun for musical legends from Cher to Sean Combs and from Shakira to The Smashing Pumpkins. 

http://tracyyoung.com/


DJ D'hana Perry - Featured DJ

D'hana Perry is a Brooklyn-based DJ and video artist. Their documentary a/v work explores identity construction, gender/racial performance and self-expression. Perry has maintained a strong presence in underground LGBTQ nightlife, having developed a unique production style that blends a globally informed mix of DIY, Club, House, Vogue, Rap, and Urbano music with the artist collective, KUNQ. Perry has had residencies at The Ace Hotel and regularly headlines some of NYC’s most notable queer dance parties and underground raves. Perry’s ongoing video performance work, LOOSE, has been featured in several print publications, and performed at such institutions as the Brooklyn Museum, MIT, the MIX New York Queer Experimental Film Festival, and the Hayden Planetarium. In their free time, Perry provides case management services for the transgender community at Callen-Lorde Community Health Center in New York City.

https://about.me/chubrub


The Haus of Mimosa - Hosts

The Real Hauswives of Queens! The Haus of Mimosa is a Juke box musical comedy featuring live vocals and improv starring New York City's favorite Italian Aunts from Queens, Anita M. Buffem (Travis Barr) & Gina Marie Rittale (Steven Incammicia). What started as the worlds FIRST Character Driven Sketch Comedy PODCAST, "Sunday Morning Mimosa", has grown into a full blown critically acclaimed LIVE character comedy show that has been compared to The Carol Burnett Show, AbFab, Kath & Kim, The Nanny, and even The Muppets. The Haus of Mimosa can be see at their weekly show at KTCHN and various venues around NYC. For more information, find them at : 

http://www.hausofmimosa.com/


The Lesbian and Gay Big Apple Corps. Marching Band - Featured Act

The Lesbian & Gay Big Apple Corps is New York City's premier symphonic and marching band. As a symphonic band, they perform several concerts each year in venues ranging from local schools and churches to Alice Tully Hall. Larger concerts are often performed in conjunction with the Lesbian and Gay Band Association, and have included performances at the Paramount Theatre, the Hollywood Bowl, the 2000 March on Washington, both inaugurations of President Clinton, and Gay Games events around the world. 

http://www.lgbac.org/

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
Once inside, feel free to go through the exhibition at your own pace, either on your own or with your fellow MEETUP members.


We'll be seeing - - -

Comic book superheroes are a part of our daily lives. They engage our imaginations on the pages of comic books, television and movie screens, as well as the Broadway stage and in the virtual world of gaming. Contemporary literature and art reference them; adults and children alike delight in donning superhero t-shirts, caps, and sneakers.

Since their introduction in the late 1930s, superheroes have been powerful role models, inspirational and enviable. Based on mythological archetypes, they reflect, respond to, and offer ways to navigate the twists and turns of modern life. Comic books are a great American art form, a cultural phenomenon born in New York City that now extends around the globe. 

Superheroes in Gotham will tell the story of the birth of comic book superheroes in New York City; the leap of comic book superheroes from the page into radio, television, and film; the role of fandom, including the yearly mega event known as New York Comic Con; and the ways in which comic book superheroes, created in the late 1930s through the 1960s, have inspired and influenced the work of contemporary comic book artists, cartoonists, and painters in New York City. 

Afterwards, some of us will going for a bite at Spring Restaurant, 83rd St and Columbus Ave. Here's the menu. Interested in joining us? Say so below in the section where it says, "Hey, get the conversation started!" so there's an accurate head count for a reservation.
results.how_to_find_us: Joel will be on line at 5:30 P.M. with an 8½- by 11-inch  MEETUP sign - the size of a piece of typewriter paper. Free Friday hours are 6 P.M. to 8 P.M.

results.description:
MoMA is PAY WHAT YOU WISH on Fridays from 4pm to 8pm. We'll meet at 6pm at a nearby cafe before heading over to the museum together. I'll send an email to attendees a day or two before the event with details.

Payment for this event includes your admission to the museum, as well as a contribution toward my Meetup Organizer fees.

If people are up for it, we'll head out for a drink/bite afterwards...

Picasso Sculpture is a sweeping survey of Pablo Picasso’s innovative and influential work in three dimensions. This will be the first such museum exhibition in the United States in nearly half a century.

Over the course of his long career, Picasso devoted himself to sculpture wholeheartedly, if episodically, using both traditional and unconventional materials and techniques. Unlike painting, in which he was formally trained and through which he made his living, sculpture occupied a uniquely personal and experimental status for Picasso. He approached the medium with the freedom of a self-taught artist, ready to break all the rules. This attitude led him to develop a deep fondness for his sculptures, to which the many photographs of his studios and homes bear witness. Treating them almost as members of his household, he cherished the sculptures' company and enjoyed re-creating them in a variety of materials and situations. Picasso kept the majority in his private possession during his lifetime. It was only in 1966, through the large Paris retrospective Hommage à Picasso, that the public became fully aware of this side of his work. Following that exhibition, in 1967 The Museum of Modern Art organized The Sculpture of Picasso, which until now was the first and only exhibition on this continent to display a large number of the artist’s sculptures.

Picasso Sculpture focuses on the artist’s lifelong work with sculpture, with a particular focus on his use of materials and processes. The exhibition, which features more than 100 sculptures, complemented by selected works on paper and photographs, aims to advance the understanding of what sculpture was for Picasso, and of how he revolutionized its history through a lifelong commitment to constant reinvention. The exhibition is organized in chapters corresponding to the distinct periods during which Picasso devoted himself to sculpture, each time exploring with fresh intensity the modern possibilities of this ancient art form.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet at a nearby cafe before heading over to the museum. I'll send an email to attendees a day or two before the event with details.
results.name: MoMA: Picasso Sculpture

results.description:
FRIDAY-November 13, 2015 will be the first of our monthly meet ups. 

Early Bird Special is only $5- click link below to purchase your ticket now.

https://njnetworkingmixer.eventbrite.com 

"NETWORKING is the single most powerful marketing tactic to accelerate and sustain success for any individual or organization!" – Adam Small


Why do I need to network?

1. As entrepreneurs and professionals, it is imperative that we stay around like minded individuals. Relationships are the catalyst for success. 


2. In this ever so growing competitive job market, you will quickly learn that it is not always what you know, but who do you know.

3. You never know what personal connection or business deal is hidden in a little conversation. 

4. If you are seasoned, you can meet a young pup with a lot of pep to do heavy lifting for you.

5. If you are new, you can meet an expert in your field and skip a lot of mistakes just by listening to their experiences. 

There are many advantages to networking. Here at the NJ Networking Circle we like to keep things fun and innovative. What better way is there to wind down a hard work week then with a little professional party and networking. We like to consider ourselves the transition group because we are not in an up tight work atmosphere, nor is it a full blown out night at the club. You can consider it to be either the cool down of a long week or the warm up to a great weekend; the choice is yours. We just want you to take a load off and have a great time meeting great people. 

Please RSVP the event and post comments or suggestions.
results.name: Meeting Of The Minds

results.description:
The American Premiere of a New Play

THE QUARE LAND
A Cantankerous Comedy

http://www.irishrep.org/thequareland.html


by John McManus
directed by Ciarán O’Reilly

September 22- November 15, 2015
At the DR2 Theatre in Union Square

Old Irish farmer Hugh Pugh is having a bubble bath; it’s his first wash in four years. His sudden interest in hygiene has been brought on by the upcoming visit of his estranged brother, but another visitor arrives mid-soak. Developer Rob McNulty is hoping to buy a field to convert to a golf course, but Hugh is far more interested in spinning yarns than signing contracts. Excruciating negotiations ensue, amidst the suds and rubber duck, in this hilarious meeting of avarice and ambition.

Price $98.00 pp ( Ticket- Bus- Parking- Tolls and Tip for the Driver)

to Check to Robert Gilligan PO box 184, Ridgewood, NJ 07451

or with Paypal.com to [masked]. 

Please send monies as "owed to a friend" to avoid fees-

Questions? robbgill@ yahoo.com

Thanks Robert 

After we will stop out for Coffee at Starbucks across the street.

results.description:
Note: To register, please answer the 2 (two) questions when you RSVP, which will ask you for your full name & e-mail. I (Thomas, your Organizer) will not be attending this event, but you are in good hands at Deutsches Haus as they have staff members on site to assist you with any questions.


We are participating in 2 parallel events this Friday, please check our calendar and pick your favorite.

What to expect

The photographs feature New York as seen through puddle reflections (appropriate for today!) and produce eerie, almost catastrophic-looking results. Hans will be present to discuss his work and answer questions.

The Exhibition

Deutsches Haus at NYU presents Apocalypse, an exhibition of photographs by Hans Weiss. 

The first time Hans Weiss moved to New York, in the 1990s, the skyscrapers in the cityscape fascinated him. As symbols of power and money they force you to look upwards and to feel small. But during rainy days they appear to fall down into the puddles forming on the streets. Back then, Weiss took a few pictures of these reflections, in black and white. 

When he moved to New York the second time, in 2014, Weiss revisited this theme, photographing the reflections in color, which added an apocalyptic dimension. A closer look at these images yielded a glimpse into another world, with eerie colors, shapes and distortions, caused by the debris, mud, leaves, undercoating, dirt, and wind. Even the reflected people seem to stem from some other place, and some other time. In these images New York is set on fire, with buildings and trees in flames, distorted, falling apart or being flooded.

The exhibition will be on display at Deutsches Haus @ NYU until December 22nd.

The Artist

Hans Weiss is a Vienna based photographer and writer. His fiction and nonfiction books sold more than five million copies and are translated into 17 languages. He received his photographic education at the ICP in 1994/95, when he was living in New York. In 1997/98 and 2010/2011 he attended the School for Art Photography in Vienna, where he enrolled in workshops of Wolfgang Tillmans and various other renowned photographers. His photographic work has been exhibited in solo exhibitions in Germany and Austria and in group exhibitions in Paris, Venice, Salzburg, and Vienna - for example his New York series success at the Museum der Moderne in Salzburg in 2012. His photographic work is mentioned in several professional journals, for instance in Camera Austria and in artmagazine. 

A new ebook by Hans Weiss, published in German by Hanser Verlag/Munich, will be available at the end of November.

For more information and pictures, see

 www.hansweiss.com

Who is hosting the event?

Deutsches Haus @ NYU is the host for this event.  They have staff members on site. There is no organizer present from our meetup, please see their staff members with any questions.

How do I get there by subway?

N/R - 8th St NYU (3 Blocks)

6 - Astor Place (4 blocks)

B/D/F/M - West 4th St (5-8 Blocks)


Please make sure you answer the questions upon you RSVP, and please, as always, update your RSVP if your plans change. It is essential to the organizer and highly appreciated!



Thomas

[masked]
