results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

results.description:
lets meet and learn about the interrelationship between depictions of royalty and the elite and literary texts from the era of the Middle Kingdom.

he reunification of ancient Egypt achieved by Nebhepetre Mentuhotep II—the first pharaoh of the Middle Kingdom—was followed by a great cultural flowering that lasted nearly 400 years. During the Middle Kingdom (mid-Dynasty 11–Dynasty 13, around 2030–1650 B.C.), artistic, cultural, religious, and political traditions first conceived and instituted during the Old Kingdom were revived and reimagined. This transformational era is represented through 230 powerful and compelling masterworks (individual objects and groups of objects) in the major international exhibition Ancient Egypt Transformed: The Middle Kingdom, which opened on October 12 at New York’s Metropolitan Museum of Art. Fashioned with great subtlety and sensitivity, and ranging in size from monumental stone sculptures to delicate examples of jewelry, the works of art are drawn from the preeminent collection of the Metropolitan—which is particularly rich in Middle Kingdom material—and 37 museums and collections in North America and Europe. This is the first comprehensive presentation of Middle Kingdom art and culture and features many objects that have never been shown in the United States. 

The astonishing continuity of ancient Egyptian culture, with certain basic principles lasting for thousands of years, gives the impression of changelessness,” said Adela Oppenheim, Curator of Egyptian Art. “But the works of art in the exhibition show that ancient Egypt constantly evolved, and was remarkably flexible within a consistent framework. New ideas did not simply replace earlier notions; they were added to what had come before, creating a fascinating society of ever-increasing complexity.”


Arranged thematically and chronologically, the exhibition opens with a forceful, monumental statue of King Mentuhotep II, carved in an intentionally archaic style that suggests a link to the legendary kings of early Egypt (ca. 3300 B.C.). 


Admission Fees: 

Pay as you wish always.

Getting there: 
BY SUBWAY

To reach the museum by subway, take the 4, 5, or 6 train to 86th Street. 

BY BUS

To reach the museum by bus, take the M1, M2, M3, or M4 bus on Madison or Fifth Avenue.

Looking forward to seeing you there.

Cheers!

( Will post my number as we get close to the meetup date)
results.name: Friday at MET - Ancient Egypt Transformed: The Middle Kingdom

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com

results.description:
Come join us for a trip to the new Whitney Museum, which just opened a new building earlier this year, situated between the Highline and the Hudson River. Fridays after 7pm is Pay What You Wish and they're open till 10.

We can meet at the new Gansevoort Market for a quick bite and then head over to the museum. Contact info will be posted. Read on for more about some of the exhibitions at the museum and offerings at the market . . . 

THE BUILDING


Designed by architect Renzo Piano, the new building includes approximately 50,000 square feet of indoor galleries and 13,000 square feet of outdoor exhibition space and terraces facing the High Line. An expansive gallery for special exhibitions is approximately 18,000 square feet in area, making it the largest column-free museum gallery in New York City. Additional exhibition space includes a lobby gallery (accessible free of charge), two floors for the permanent collection, and a special exhibitions gallery on the top floor. 

According to Mr. Piano, “The design for the new museum emerges equally from a close study of the Whitney’s needs and from a response to this remarkable site. We wanted to draw on its vitality and at the same time enhance its rich character. The first big gesture, then, is the cantilevered entrance, which transforms the area outside the building into a large, sheltered public space. At this gathering place beneath the High Line, visitors will see through the building entrance and the large windows on the west side to the Hudson River beyond. Here, all at once, you have the water, the park, the powerful industrial structures and the exciting mix of people, brought together and focused by this new building and the experience of art.”

The dramatically cantilevered entrance along Gansevoort Street shelters an 8,500-square-foot outdoor plaza or “largo,” a public gathering space steps away from the southern entrance to the High Line. The building also includes an education center offering state-of-the-art classrooms; a multi-use black box theater for film, video, and performance with an adjacent outdoor gallery; a 170-seat theater with stunning views of the Hudson River; and a Works on Paper Study Center, Conservation Lab, and Library Reading Room. The classrooms, theater, and study center are all firsts for the Whitney. 

A retail shop on the ground-floor level contributes to the busy street life of the area. A ground-floor restaurant and top-floor cafe are operated by renowned restaurateur Danny Meyer and his Union Square Hospitality Group.

Mr. Piano’s design takes a strong and strikingly asymmetrical form—one that responds to the industrial character of the neighboring loft buildings and overhead railway while asserting a contemporary, sculptural presence. The upper stories of the building overlook the Hudson River on its west, and step back gracefully from the elevated High Line Park to its east.

The Metropolitan Museum of Art plans to present exhibitions and educational programming at the Whitney’s uptown building for a period of eight years, with the possibility of extending the agreement for a longer term.

The Museum will present a career retrospective of Frank Stella (b. 1936), one of the most important living American artists. This survey will be the most comprehensive presentation of Stella’s career to date, showcasing his prolific output from the mid-1950s to the present through approximately 120 works, including paintings, reliefs, maquettes, sculptures, and drawings. Co-organized by the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth and the Whitney, this exhibition will feature Stella’s best-known works alongside rarely seen examples drawn from collections around the world. Accompanied by a scholarly publication, the exhibition will fill the Whitney's entire fifth floor, an 18,000-square-foot gallery that is the Museum’s largest space for temporary exhibitions.

Archibald John Motley Jr. (1891–1981) was a bold and highly original modernist and one of the great visual chroniclers of twentieth-century American life. He first came to prominence in the 1920s during the early days of the Harlem Renaissance—the cultural flowering of African American art, music, and literature that extended beyond the New York neighborhood of its name to other cities, notably Chicago, where Motley spent most of his life. Motley had a long career and enjoyed recognition for his work early on, yet went through subsequent periods of struggle and obscurity. 

Motley was born in New Orleans, but his family moved to Chicago when he was quite young, and he later became one of the first black artists to attend the School of the Art Institute of Chicago. His training there was academic, rigorously focused on the human figure, and steeped in European tradition. Motley’s sophisticated understanding of art history is especially apparent in his sympathetic portraits, but it was a history that he challenged and advanced with his raucous scenes of everyday urban life. 

While Edward Hopper, Thomas Hart Benton, and Reginald Marsh became much more famous than Motley for their American scenes, he also developed and elucidated his own archetypes of place and people in this country, albeit unapologetically based on African American subject matter. As the work on view in Archibald Motley: Jazz Age Modernisteloquently attests, Motley rightly holds a place among the great American modernists. The artist created a far more daring visual language than many of his contemporaries, fusing vivid narrative with dizzying spatial distortion and jarring hues to produce striking settings for characters of diverse racial backgrounds and social classes. And while his portrayals range from serene and august portraits to abrasive or outrageous caricatures, all were his instruments for addressing the poignancy, folly, and complexity of modern life.

Gansevoort Market:

The BRUFFIN is a light and flaky, brioche-like pastry filled with high quality ingredients sourced from around the world to give each one its exclusive character and taste. Available in a diverse assortment of savory and sweet flavors, the Bruffin is the perfect meal in a muffin for any time of the day—making them the ultimate catered treat and conversation-starter for office happy hours, corporate events, and private parties! Flavors include The American BRUFFIN (buffalo chicken, blue cheese and hot sauce),The French BRUFFIN (lardons, gruyere and brie) and The Spanish (Chorizo, Manchego cheese and Ancho chile) to name a few.

Brings full flavors from Bangkok city to New York cooking real pad Thai curries, traditional favorites & inspired cocktails from the heart of BKK.


. . . and much more

results.description:
$25 Special Discounted Admission with promo code SAMANTHA.

($45 Regular Admission).

Our special promo code for the eventbrite registration is SAMANTHA. Use that Code for the eventbrite registration. Otherwise you will end up paying regular price of $45. Purchase Tickets here:

https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10038019


Our group is participating in 2 parallel events this Friday. Please check out our calendar and pick your favorite.


Samantha Hoefer will perform and she courteously gave our group a special discount to attend the event. 

Scroll down for more details on the performance.

Find more information about Samantha Hoefer on her website.

If you can not attend on this date, or if the event is sold out by the time you register, there will be another performance on the 14th, as well as  additional performances in December. Make note of the promo code SAMANTHA as that code will work on ALL days that Samantha Hoefer is performing.


When to be there

I scheduled the event for 6:30pm to ensure everyone is settled by 7:00pm at which the show will start. No one will be seated after 7:00pm sharp.

If you failed to register, you may be able to get regular tickets at 06:30pm if the event is not sold out.

How to get there by subway

A/C/E & B/D/F/M: West 4th St - 1 Block away

Check for weekend schedule, not all trains are running


Accessibility

The event (including the bathrooms) are NOT handicapped accessible. A walk up to the 3rd Floor is required, there is NO ELEVATOR.


The Event

Sylvia Milo's award-winning THE OTHER MOZART, directed by Isaac James Byrne, is the true, untold story of Nannerl Mozart, the sister of Amadeus -- a prodigy, keyboard virtuoso and composer, who performed throughout Europe with her brother to equal acclaim, but her work and her story faded away, lost to history. 

On Nov 13th, the performance is by Samantha Hoefer (shows alternate between Sylvia Milo & Samantha Hoefer performing).

Setting & Design

The one-woman drama is set in and on a magnificent 18-foot dress, created to fill and spill over the entire stage. THE OTHER MOZART is based on facts, stories and lines pulled directly from the Mozart family's humorous and heartbreaking letters.

With the opulent beauty of the dress and hair design, the sweet smell of perfume and the clouds of dusting powder rising from the stage, THE OTHER MOZART is a multi-sensual experience that transports the audience into a world of outsized beauty and delight - but also of overwhelming restrictions and prejudice where, finally, this other Mozart tells her story. Period style movement creates a world of opulence and elegance through articulate delicacy of expressive balletic gestures, reverent court bows, and fan language.

Music

Along with music composed by her famous brother and Marianna Martines (a female composer who inspired Nannerl), the play features original music by Nathan Davis and Phyllis Chen --- featured composers of the Mostly Mozart Festival at Lincoln Center, BAM and the International Contemporary Ensemble -- for the instruments Nannerl knew intimately such as clavichords, music boxes and bells, as well as teacups, fans, and other ordinary objects that might have captured her imagination.

The production features music composed by Nathan Davis and Phyllis Chen (of Lincoln Center's Mostly Mozart Festival and the International Contemporary Ensemble) with additional music by Marianna Martines and Wolfgang A. Mozart. Sound design by Nathan Davis. Period style movement directed by Janice Orlandi. Costume design by Magdalena Dabrowska (dress) and Miodrag Guberinic (pannier / corset sculpture), with dress concept by Anna Sroka and hair design by Courtney Bednarowski. Lighting design by Joshua Rose.

Origins & Performances

THE OTHER MOZART was developed at the Piccolo Spoleto festival and at the Cherry Lane Theatre in NYC as part of the All For One Festival. It was presented at the Berkshire and New Orleans Fringe festivals, at Toronto University and in Munich at the Pasinger Fabrik. The play repeatedly returned to Austria in 2014 at the invitation of the Mozarteum Foundation and Mozarteum University in Salzburg. The play had a critically acclaimed Off-Broadway run at the HERE Arts Center in New York City, and in London at St. James Theater. It continues touring internationally.

Awards & Nominations

THE OTHER MOZART was nominated for the 2015 Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Sound Design in a Play and the 2015 Off Broadway Alliance Award for Best Solo Performance. 

The play was nominated for eight New York Innovative Theatre Awards: 

Outstanding Solo Performance - Sylvia Milo, 

Outstanding Director - Isaac Byrne, 

Outstanding Costume Design - Magdalena Dabrowska & Miodrag Guberinic, 

Outstanding Set Design - Anna Sroka, 

Outstanding Sound Design - Nathan Davis, 

Outstanding Original Music - Phyllis Chen & Nathan Davis, 

Outstanding Original Full-length script - Sylvia Milo and 

Outstanding Premiere Production of a Play, 

winning Outstanding Solo Performance and Outstanding Original Music.

Press & Articles

Broadway World (event description largely from here).

The Guardian

The New York Times


The Wall Street Journal


Official Page (see for more articles)

• Come today with a card PREPARED for everyone to create inspired by something(s) that you are thankful for-interpret this as you wish.  

• Please bring your finished sample and all of the supplies (cut & ready) for all of the participants to create your card. This includes the stamps, ink, papers and all embellishments. You can bring your project in a box or bag-whatever is convenient for you. (Products can be from any company.) If you have been to my card classes, I envision you bringing the same type of supplies prepped as I do in my classes. 


• ***Please create something that you would be proud to share, create and give to someone else! This is your chance to try a new idea or technique.***

• I would love to do this each month and change the theme. I am anticipating these seats to fill up quickly so please RSVP as soon as you can. If you are unable to come, please change your RSVP to free up the spot for someone else. 

• Each participant needs to bring them own scissors, adhesives, etc. This is a free event so I will not be providing those things today.• ***If you need ideas, suggestions or supplies please contact me in advance. There are countless card samples on Pinterest. There are many supplies from Stampin' Up! which I can help with but there is no pressure to use SU items for this event.***

venue.name: Columbia University Pupin Physics Laboratories on the Morningside Campus

results.description:
It seems like people had a good time at the last event, so let's try again! 

Listen to a fascinating lecture on astronomy and then do a little stargazing in Columbia's observatory! This lecture is: The Dark Matter of Ghost Galaxies, presented by Jana Grcevich. The lecture is about 45 minutes and stargazing (weather permitted) is 90 minutes, using the telescopes in the observatory.

Link with more info: http://outreach.astro.columbia.edu/calendar/ 

Let's meet around 6:30, as the lecture hall fills up quickly. For anyone arriving late, the lecture hall is located on the 4th floor, and signs are posted.
results.how_to_find_us: So the lecture hall is actually closer to 120th Street. You can enter at 116th and walk through campus, or enter on 120th and it's up about 4 flights of stairs to get to the campus. Let's meet outside building and go in together.
results.name: Columbia Astronomy Stargazing and Lecture Series

results.description:
Join us again at E's Bar for this social #drinkingaboutmuseums #NYC! Check out E's Bar NYC on Twitter (@EBarNYC) and Instagram (@ebarnyc). Visit their website for a look at the great menu and drinks. E's Bar continues to be an amazing venue and supporter for the group! 

We'll gather Friday, November 13, 2015 from 6:30-8:00PM. Come into the bar and look for the group. We'll be in the back of the bar, so go upstairs and make your way back. All drinks and food items are à la carte. Order at the bar. RSVP via Meetup. Tweet @nealstimler and contact me via Meetup with your questions or concerns. 

Our special guest this time is from New Zealand! You'll meet Melissa Firth (@mslissa), Chief Digital Officer of the Te Papa Museum of New Zealand (@Te_Papa). Get to know Melissa by watching her talk from the New Zealand National Digital Forum 2015 and connect with her on LinkedIn. 

This meetup is for those in the arts, culture and entertainment industries, particularly designers, developers, entrepreneurs, museum professionals and creative technologists. Note: Please only RSVP if you are coming to the event. 

It is important we keep slots open for those committed to attending. Having an accurate count of attendees is also important to our relationships with event partners. Come ready to be social and introduce yourself to the group.
results.name: #drinkingaboutmuseums #NYC hosts Melissa Firth of Te Papa Museum New Zealand.

results.description:
Tonight we will be watching and discussing the first part of the four part series Inner Worlds Outer Worlds.

Tonight's topic is Akasha.

Akasha is the unmanifested, the "nothing" or emptiness which fills the vacuum of space. As Einstein realized, empty space is not really empty. Mystics, by looking within, have also realized that this perceived emptiness is an unfathomable power, a web of information or energy which connects all things.

You can access Part One of the Series - Akasha - here!

Summary:

There is one vibratory field that connects all things. It has been called Akasha, Logos, the primordial OM, the music of the spheres, the Higgs field, dark energy, and a thousand other names throughout history. The vibratory field is at the root of all true spiritual experience and scientific investigation. It is the same field of energy that saints, Buddhas, yogis, mystics, priests, shamans and seers, have observed by looking within themselves. Many of history's monumental thinkers, such a Pythagoras, Kepler, Leonardo DaVinci, Tesla, and Einstein, have come to the threshold of this great mystery. It is the common link between all religions, all sciences, and the link between our inner worlds and our outer worlds.

All are Welcome
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Inner Worlds, Outer Worlds: Akasha

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Friday Japanese/English Language Exchange

Join us for 2 hours every “Friday Japanese / English Language Exchange!" In this event, you will get to learn about English and Japanese as well as socialize with other members! If you would like to practice and learn more English and Japanese, then this is your event!

毎週金曜日２時間実施される金曜日、英語日本語語学交流会にぜひお越し下さい！イベントでは日本語と英語を学ぶことはもちろんのこと、他のメンバーさんとの交流も楽しんで頂けます。

Details:

Lessons: Varying levels of Japanese and English lessons are given at multiple stations, focusing on aspects such as grammar, listening, and conversation.

Language Exchange: After the lessons, we have a free exchange for people in both languages.

詳細:

レッスン：文法、リッスニング、会話などに焦点をおいた日本語、英語のそれぞれのレベルに合わせたレッスンが受講できます。

語学交流会： レッスン後、両語学による自由な交流会をになります。

Time:

Every Friday, from 6:45pm to 8:45pm

Entrance fee: $5.00

Chelsea Studios

151 West 26th Street 6th Floor New York, NY 10001

TO ATTEND YOU MUST REGISTER AT - [masked]


We will watch videos, read short stories, write and discuss how to use this beautiful philosophy of Chuang Tzu and Taoism to live a richer, fuller life.


Two books that you might want to look at are:


1.  Chuang Tzu, Basic Writings by B. Watson

2.  The Way of Chuang Tzu by T. Merton 

We will be using the videos of the www.edx.org course “Chinese Thought: Ancient Wisdom Meets Modern Science” by Edward Slingerland. This course is Free, all one has to do is register for it. It explores various ancient Chinese philosophers including: Confucius (Ritual and Society), Mohist (Benefit and Utility), Mencius (Thought and Reason), and of course Taoists - Lao Tzu and Chuang Tzu (Nature and Simplicity). We will be focusing on the Chuang Tzu/Zhuangzi video section #6.

Also see a wonderful 30 minute video on “Tai Chi and Yin-Yang Philosophy”: Al Huang https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8TSEnoAa39s

LOCATION: All Souls Unitarian Church 80th Street and Lexington Ave.-  Downstairs “Gallery”

DATE/TIME: Friday evening starting at 7 pm sharp (come by 6:45 to get a good seat). Friday Nov 13th and 20th, Dec 4th and 11th from 7-9 pm

REGISTRATION:  Please e-mail us that you are coming - [masked]

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
*Check out CNY's first Kickstarter Campaign!

----

MLC Event Host needed.  Please contact Yen.  Thank you.

About the Speaker

"Gary J. Bass is the author of Freedom’s Battle: The Origins of Humanitarian Intervention and Stay the Hand of Vengeance: The Politics of War Crimes Tribunals. He is a professor of politics and international affairs at Princeton University. A former reporter for The Economist, he often writes for The New York Times and has also written for The New Yorker, The Washington Post, The Los Angeles Times, The Boston Globe, The New Republic, Foreign Affairs, Foreign Policy, Slate, and other publications." 

"In this impressively researched book about the South Asian crisis that culminated in the birth of Bangladesh in 1971, Gary J. Bass argues the major responsibility for “forgotten genocide” falls on two men—Richard Nixon and Henry Kissinger. Bass offers his book as an indictment of the shortsighted decision making that abetted the genocidal murder of hundreds of thousands of Hindus in the final days of East Pakistan. —Lloyd Gardner --This text refers to an out of print or unavailable edition of this title."


Amazon reviews:   http://www.amazon.com/The-Blood-Telegram-Gary-Bass/dp/0307744620

Convener:  New York Military Affairs Symposium  http://bobrowen.com/nymas/
results.name: "The Blood Telegram: Nixon, Kissinger, and a Forgotten Genocide" Gary J. Bass

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/masks.jpeg?itok=rQjAifLU (6:30pm reception - light refreshments) 

Ethics and the Theater will present a play reading of The Collection, by Harold Pinter.

Directed by Richard Van Deusen

An ominous phone call embroils two couples in accusations of infidelity, contradicting one another and themselves, by turns menacing, comic, pathetic, and violent, grasping after ever-elusive truth. Come at 6:30 for the reception, and stay after the play for a discussion of the ethical issues it raises. 

Come at 6:30 pm for a reception and after the reading participate in a discussion of the ethical issues of the play led by Betsy Ungar.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
November's caller is the delightful Mary Wesley and the band is the sweet, high -energy Sassafras Stomp!

Contra dancing is a great way to have fun, meet new people, burn a few calories and let loose all the stress of the week!

Beginners' Workshop begins at 6:30 pm.  Contra Dance is a traditional American folk dance which requires no prior dance training or experience—if you can walk, you can Contra Dance.  Traditional Contra Dancing is done with "Ladies and Gents" but at Gender Role-Free Dances we dance whichever role we like and with whomever we like!  Our monthly dances are open to everyone, regardless of sexual orientation, gender expression, dance experience and number of left feet.

Join us after the dance for socializing at the Village Den around the corner at 11th St. and Greenwich Ave.


For more information, check out our new website: www.villagecontra.org or our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/villagecontra/

In our first Meetup, will play a game of Speed Chatting. A non-native English speaker will be paired with a native English speaker and made to speak for 3 minutes. After that, every one will find a new partner.  A set vocabulary list will be handed out so that members can learn and practice new expressions and words in a natural setting. This will help us warm up a little and get comfortable with each other.


Once everyone has had a chance to meet, we'll move on to some open conversation with wine and snacks.

results.description:
It's back again, the annual NY Horror Film Festival, this time around the Lifetime Achievement award will be awarded to Sean Cunningham. Admission to program  5 allows you to be there for the award presentation. This will sell out, so get your tickets at the link below.

Program 5 KILL BAR THEATER

$20

Friday 11/13….7:15 pm

Shorts:

MERIDIANS……………..8 MINS……………………Dir. Blake Rice
PAINKILLER…………….16 MINS………………….Dir. Jeremiah Kipp

Feature Film:

SAVE YOURSELF ………88 MINS…………………Dir. Ryan M. Andrews….NYC Premier


Five women en route to Los Angeles, to screen their horror film, cross paths with a mysterious scientist hell-bent on using them for his bizarre research.Crystal is the tough-as-nails director, Dawn is the by-the-numbers producer, Kim is the girl next door lead actress, Sasha is the promiscuous supporting actress and Lizzy is the loner writer. Together the five women have made a fun and bloody horror film.Before heading to Los angeles, the ladies screen their movie in a sleepy town – but they may never be heard from again. Stranded in the middle of nowhere, Crystal goes missing and the others set out the look for her. Their search leads them to a secluded old house and before they know it, they are all taken prisoner by the mysterious couple living there,Trapped in the house, the five women become unwitting subjects for their bizarre research. As they struggle for survival, they uncover a deeper purpose behind the horrifying experiments and realize that truth is stranger than fiction.

https://youtu.be/QdK_D8PK7c4

The link for tickets:

http://nychorrorfest.com/schedule/

results.description: I thought it was time to setup a nice restaurant before the holidays are upon us. Because of the close date I was only able to booked this on a Friday. Also, I will not asked for confirmations for this because the event is near but please don't RSVP unless you are 95% certain. OK, let's talk about the restaurant. Pepela is the first Georgian Restaurant in NYC. It is a fusion of modern Europe & tradional Georgian cuisine situated in the Flatiron District. The posh maisonette offers an area for cocktails upstairs while downstairs offers a comfortable & romantic dining area. An average entree here is $24. Each couple will be responsible for the cost of their own meal. Make this Friday the 13th a wonderful dining experience with new and old friends.
results.name: Pepela

We are proud to announce that this Friday, we are helping promote breast cancer awareness and early detection with Climb For The Cure!  The fundraiser will support the "Susan G Komen for the Cure" Foundation - the world's largest source of nonprofit funds dedicated to curing breast cancer.

People of all ages and all fitness levels are welcome!  We encourage you to come by and participate.  We'll have exciting individual and group activities to make this night an awesome event.  You don't even need to climb to come have fun!

So grab the kids, grab some friends and register NOW to be a part of the Climb For The Cure!

It's only $20 to participate and ALL proceeds will go towards the cause.  Don't forget to wear your pink!

We welcome a variety of talents to come and share in music or performing arts.  Any family friendly performances are welcome at any skill level.  The Open Mike Nights strives to be a judgement free night where we can come together with the common interest of music and art.

We will have an Open Mike Night on Friday November 13th @ 7PM. 

We will provide food and drinks at the Open Mike Night Cafe. 

We have a piano, a few plug ins for acoustic guitars and other instruments and a couple of microphones. 

Individuals or groups can play about three songs. There will be a sign-up sheet at the front door.  The Open Mike Night is FREE and will always be free.  The only cost is a free-will donation for the food and snacks. 


We ask that all music and performances be family-friendly as there will be a wide variety of ages present. 


If you have any questions feel free to email me at [masked] or (201)[masked]

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Check out the pics from the Walk Around Astoria we did the last time. It was sick!!  

Starting at the end of the N/Q line in Astoria with multiple meetup groups, we will casually stroll down Ditmars Blvd, then saunter along Shore Blvd next to Astoria Park following this route which has amazing views of Hell Gate Bridge, Robert F. Kennedy Bridge, Randall's Island, the East River and New York City. Like really, really amazing! 

Afterwards: If you are inclined, we'll pop on over to a bar/restaurant I like to bring my people to when I hold walking events in Astoria. It's a combination of indoor and outdoor seating and they have a great selection of everything: drinks, food, ambiance, and the subway is right there too. 

Meeting Time: 7 PM. Walk-start time: 7:30 PM. If you are even 1 minute late you will miss us. 

Pace/Distance/Duration: The pace of this walk will be easy-going. The total distance is a little over 4 miles. The approximated time from start to finish is 1.5 hours with photo opp stops. 

If this is your first time attending a meetup, try not to worry. Around 90% of attendees are first timers so you won't be alone. Most people come solo and I encourage that. In a matter of minutes you'll be engrossed in a conversation with someone and then another and another and so on. Every 10 minutes or so I make the guys switch with the girls so everyone gets a chance to talk to everyone. You'll meet like a trillion people! 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of McDonald's at the last stop of the N/Q line (Ditmars Blvd) and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. Alternatively, you can CALL the organizer at [masked] 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­
results.name: Astoria Singles Night Walk | Age: 21 to 49

Marie-Catherine

results.description:
Magick 101 - Class 5: Sex Magick

These classes are designed for people who are new to Magick. Perhaps you are skeptical, or even a little fearful.


And probably no subject is more fraught with taboos and misconceptions than sex magick. Crowley absorbed the influences of Tantra and created a new avenue of magical experimentation. We’ll look at the practice of Tantra and how it evolved into modern sex magick. We will also do a clothed ritual that borrows from both Tantra and sex magick.


It doesn’t matter if you have missed earlier classes, each class will give you an entry-way into understanding and practicing Magick.


To RSVP for this event and receive directions, please email [masked].

Admission: $10

results.description:
Most of us are so busy going places - in our lives and in our thoughts - that we are rarely present for what’s in front of us. When you discover how to access and live in the current moment not only are you more effective, productive and satisfied, but you become a healing presence for yourself and those around you. 

This meetup is an introduction to an easy, practical approach to living in the moment. Inspired by the work of Ariel and Shya Kane, it’s a way for people with busy, modern lives to experience everyday well-being and satisfaction. 

Join us for a fun evening, meet some great people, and discover what a difference you make just by being here and being you!

results.description:
GENERAL DIS-ASSEMBLY NIGHT

Once a month we are putting together a night of pure DESTRUCTION!!!!! (Evil laugh).  The goal is simple, grab a item off the surplus shelf, strip it bare of all salvageable parts (screws, nuts, bolts, springs, clamps, motors, sensors, circuit boards, etc.) and discard the remains.   We are looking to increase our parts inventory while also decreasing our surplus.  It's a great opportunity to pear inside the magic of electronic's and learn about different components.  Join us tonight for pure DESTRUCTION at its best. Free and open to the public.

WARNING: Plan ahead, wear comfortable clothes that you don't mind getting messy, and be prepared to get dirty!

OPEN CRAFT NIGHT Continues:

Come make stuff! Bring a project in any state, an idea, or just  come to hang out with us while we work on projects, spontaneous brainstorms are on the forecast.

This event is free and open to the public.   

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.] 

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.  

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar

results.description:
Friday the 13th is coming up in November and the best way to avoid all the dangers that might befall you is to go outside with millions of other people and drink lots of alchohol. The Akita Sake Tasting Event occurs every spring an autumn. With dozens of sakes available for tasting, if you've ever wanted to try a bit of every sake in a liquor store now's your chance. Join us on Friday night and let's enjoy some sake.

FROM THE AKITA SAKE CLUB:

The Akita Sake Club (ASC) was established in June 2006 to introduce sake, food and culture from Akita Prefecture to the sake lovers of the NYC area. This Autumn ASC is proud to announce “The Autumn Akita Sake Tasting Event” on November13, 2015. This is our 21st tasting event since 2006 and we greatly appreciate those who have supported us in the past. 

At this event we will present more than 45 of the finest sakes not only from Akita and the other northern Tohoku Regions, but also from all over Japan.  Ms. Chizuko Niikawa, a renowned sake somelier will also be present to answer questions regarding our sake offerings.  Savor some of Akita’s delicacies such as Kiritanpo, Akita’s Miso & Honey Glazed Chicken, Iburi Gakko (smoked pickled radish), Akita Miso-flavored Mozzarella Cheese and so on. 

You will also enjoy performances by guest musicians Mr. Gaku Takanashi who will be performing on the guitar and Shamisen and Mr. Richard Bennett who will be playing the piano.
We hope you can join us for this special 21st Tasting Event.

Go “green” and bring your own sake glass. We will provide plastic tasting cups but glass or ceramic is highly recommended over plastic so as not to alter sake’s delicate flavor.

Organizer:
The Akita Sake Club (Akita Yukari no Kai)

Sponsor:
Sun Pop International Corporation

Date:
Friday, November 13, 2015

Time:
7:00pm to 9:00pm

Location:
The Japanese American Association of New York, Inc.

Address:
49 West 45th Street, 11th Floor
New York, NY 10036
(Between 5th Avenue and 6th Avenue)

Admission: $50. 

Please pay in cash at the reception desk when you arrive.
results.name: 2015 Autumn Akita Sake Tasting Event

results.description:
Author Michael Urheber: The Utility of Seeing the Extraordinary in the Everyday

How does one wake up the sleeping giant that is your God-given consciousness? You and only you are the gatekeeper of that infinite space, in which everything that occurs is in actuality an invitation to discover the vast potentiality that allows every “thing” to occur in the first place. By participating in that reality, by becoming that realty, you open yourself to spirit, to love, to freedom.

If Michael’s story doesn’t turn you into a believer, then he will at least help you set the stage for your own healing and validation of a world that’s ready to “play” when you are.  His book, Bava’s Gift: Awakening to the Impossible, is a true story of survival, of synchronicity to the tenth power, of a friendship (and an experiment) that proves love and consciousness endure beyond this earthy plane.

Bava’s Gift: Awakening to the Impossible is available at http://icrl.org/bavas-gift/ and from all online booksellers.
results.name: Author Michael Urheber: The Utility of Seeing the Extraordinary in the Everyday

Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!

results.description:
Our November meeting of the Staten Island Geological Society, Inc. will feature an illustrated presentation on "Mastodons, Woolly Mammoths and Other Ice Age Creatures" by geologist Steve Okulewicz from the Geology Department at Hofstra University. Mastodons (not to be confused with woolly mammoths) are large, elephant-like creatures that roamed forested lands and swamps on every continent on Earth except Antarctica and Australia, during the Pleistocene Epoch, approximately 28 million to 8 thousand years ago. In Staten Island and New Jersey, the remains of these 6-ton vegetation-browsing beasts have been found in several localities, as teeth, tusks, and bones. Come see what these creatures and other mega-fauna from the Ice Age looked like, discover how they lived, what they ate, and speculate on how they all died out, or did they? New scientific research has provided an opportunity to perhaps revive some of these formerly"extinct" beasts. Learn what is currently brewing in biologists test tubes containing the DNA of some of these creatures.

Also, for those new 60-members who have joined this web site and this particular Meet-up, it would be great to see some of you at this meeting!
results.name: November Meeting of the Staten Island Geological Society

results.description:
Please join us for a thought-provoking discussion about the present and past role of women at the mosque. We will have a presentation on the subject followed by an open discussion. Come share your thoughts and ideas on this important topic. “Can you make me understand why you have brushed woman into the background of your lives –although women around the Prophet and his Companions took part in so grand a manner in the life of their men?” –Muhammad Asad

There is considerable evidence in the books of Hadith that substantiate the claim that segregation of women did not exist during the time of the Prophet (PBUH). A Hadith reported in the Book of Muslim, for instance, states that Umm Hisham, daughter of Haritha, who was the son of Ne’man said: “I memorized sura Qaf from hearing it from Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) because he used to recite it during his khutbah on Fridays.”

Similarly, Ibn Abbas, the paternal cousin of Muhammad (PBUH), reported that “A beautiful woman, from among the most beautiful of women, used to pray behind the Prophet (PBUH).” This Hadith was narrated by Ibn Majah, Abu Dawud, Attayalisy, Baihaqi, Ahmad, Tirmidhi, Nasai and others. It was judged authentic by Sheikh Al-Albaanee in his book, Silsilat Al-Ahaadeeth (Saheehah #2472), where he quoted many scholars who determined it to be true.

The exclusion and seclusion of women in Muslim communities is based on custom and culture rather than on Islam. With the passage of time, culture and religion have become so intertwined as to be virtually inextricable. However, it is time for these archaic and destructive traditions to change. As Muhammad Asad writes, “neither in the Quran, nor in the life example of the Prophet do we find any warrant for these practices, which later found [their] way into Muslim society from Byzantium.”

We will have some light foods and a discussion after the film. You are welcome to bring healthy snacks to share.

Notice: The attendees will be requested to contribute $ 5 each to help with the cost of renting the meeting room.
results.name: The Role of Women at the Mosque

results.description:
Afterwork Salsa In The City @ the World Famous Copa Cabana

The perfect afterwork salsa party at the original venue for salsa in NYC, The Copa Cabana.

results.description:
Friday Tango with MARIA OLIVERA & GUSTAVO BENZECRY @ La Milonga Rosa


Beginner tango classes at  7:30 pm ( No Experience necessary)
Intermediate class 8:30 pm

Open Dance til 2:30 am

Dinner, Drinks optional

DJ MORAL

Performances by MARIA OLIVERA & GUSTAVO BENZECRY 

Gustavo & María and they started teaching together at the 

famous Salón Canning, in Buenos Aires. Their teaching method is both precise and gradual and because of this, they’re among the most popular sought out teachers. They regularly teach workshops in their home town of Buenos Aires and in the international festivals and events. Their kindness and good sense of humor make the learning very effective for the students. Gustavo is patient and reflective, María brings dynamism and clarity in the concepts. They are especially known for their musicality, agility and elegant, but playful style of social dance. Maria's lightening-fast feet will AMAZE you, and if you've never seen Gustavo's "milonga moonwalk," get ready! Gustavo stands out for his elegance, creativity and musicality, and María for her quick adornments and her musical precision. Together they also work hard on promoting the Tango as a culture. Gustavo has written several books (all of them translated into different languages) and with María they’ve produced instructional dvds on techniques for leaders and followers as well as a documentary on the history of the dance in the 40’s and 50’s, that they screen with educational purposes. http://www.tangosalon.com.ar/ I hope you make it!


Check also

http://www.dancetango.com and
http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=26590514004

What to Expect.
Relax. It's Easy.

 

Classes are led by experts, many with thousands of hours of experience and deep knowledge and skill. In addition, there are often people training to become instructors who are happy to offer individual guidance.

 

Classes are tailored to the needs of the attendees. A starter session will be given if there are newcomers. New techniques and insights are always available for regulars. Advanced techniques may also be explored.

 

Classes begin with a brief announcement and introduction followed by 30-40 minutes of instruction and practice. Typically, classes are no more than an hour. Not long, considering the benefits can last a life time.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
RSVPs open 3 days prior to event at 8pm.

This evening is Competitive Play (Intermediate/Advance). Perfect for those who want to step-up their game. 

Having less experienced players in the more intense Friday night setting is both unsafe and unfair to the other attendees. But all are welcome to attend Sunday nights. (Use your own judgement of skill level before signing up for Friday) 

Players are expected to be able to handle free pass, pass accurately, and most important "BUMP SET SPIKE" with every effort not to just return the ball on the other side. Regular volleyball rules will be more closely enforced


Please RSVP only if you are 100% sure you can make it. No refunds will be issued if you decide to cancel.  

If you must cancel or can't make it allow your spot to be given to someone on the wait list. 

2 Cancellations/No-Shows = 1 Month Ban


RULES:

-Carrying will be called

-Doubles will be called if too obvious

- NO REDOS on ANY ceiling obstacles

-No top Net touches (Bottom Net is okay if it doesn't interfere with play)

-No going under the net on the opposite side of the court. (Safety)

results.description:
The Grabers have offered up their home for this weeks DWA.  Weather permitting we can grill.  

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

Since those that came last year had a blast, we're posting the same charity event from last year to benefit the organization Breaking Ground. Check out 2014's photos:

http://www.meetup.com/justnotalone/photos/25777660/#[masked]

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.775484452544525.1073741834.621599691266336&type=1


One of our members, De, is part of Breaking Ground's Young Professional Committee (YPC). Breaking Ground is a non-profit organization that creates supportive and affordable housing for homeless and other vulnerable New Yorkers.

YPC will be throwing a 1920s speakeasy themed party at The Prince George Ballroom. This includes a 4-hour premium open bar, catering by Neuman's Kitchen, live Performance by Baby Soda and Music by DJ Brendan Jay Sullivan. Buy your tickets in advance and it costs less than a normal NYC weekend night out of dinner and drinks! Last year there were almost 300 guests who partied to their hearts content and helped to raise $15K for charity.

Also, raffle prizes/silent auctions from: Artichoke Pizza, Avenue Nightclub, Catbird, Cyc Hell's Kitchen, The Lowell New York, Trump International Hotel & Tower NY- Central Park, Warby Parker and much more!

Ticket prices are as follows:
$85 in advance or $120 at the door  

Purchase early as price will increase to $95 on Friday, November 6th!

https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/12088153_10109554803464154_8291190430494636175_n.jpg?oh=43de3b7ae31e100c581d80c77cd62f35&oe=569B1CAE


Advance tickets are available through Eventbrite here:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/young-professionals-committee-roaring-20s-speakeasy-soiree-tickets-18426374783

Come out for a fun party night of food, drinks, music, and dancing that will cost less than an equivalent night out in NYC! All the proceeds from the event go to a tremendous cause. Come out and have fun with us... if the same thing occurs like last time, we'll continue the after party elsewhere. Here's to hoping we can walk straight out of there... What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.

 

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

results.description:
Big Brothers Big Sisters of NYC's Asian Mentoring Committee is hosting its 3rd annual Night Market Loft Party! This fundraising event offers guests all-inclusive food from local vendors, an open bar, music from DJ Furen, raffle prizes, photobooth, a special performance, and much more. Peek at our vendors, raffle prizes, and ticket rates at amcnightmarket2015.splashthat.com 

Curated by dedicated BBBS of NYC volunteers, this signature fundraiser puts a philanthropic spin on the traditional Night Market, allowing guests to support one of NYC's most prominent nonprofits while celebrating local flavors, cuisines and entertainment.


The goal of this event is to support our long-term vision of creating enough sustainable income ($50,000/year) to serve an additional 50 children from immigrant families through Big Brothers Big Sisters of NYC's mentoring program.
results.name: Third Annual Night Market Loft Party

results.description:
Come Join Us For A Friday The 13th Party In November! A MULTI-GROUP EVENT!

Ironically you might get lucky on this day and win one of our giftcards or prizes in our raffle. We start meeting as early as 8pm. This is a recently open venue in the heart of the Meadowlands. Completely renovated and ready for us to chill, socialize, and party at.

We'll have a reserved area on the 1st floor with some nice couches, TVs, dance floor, and a beautiful Pool Table as well (Free To Play). Bar available for drinks as well as a food menu for ordering.

Management is also allowing access to the gorgeous 2ND FLOOR VIP AREA WITH VELVET COUCHES & PRIVATE POOL TABLES for our members. Do Note It May Be Unavailable After 10pm If Another Party Rents It Out.

DJ Music Scheduled To Start At About 10pm. Expect To Hear A Nice Club Mix Of Top 40, Classics, & More.


$5 ENTRY GOOD TIL 10PM. JUST MENTION MEETUP AT THE DOOR.

YOU'LL RECEIVE A HANDSTAMP TO HAVE ACCESS TO OUR RESERVED AREAS AND SELECT DRINK & FOOD SPECIALS TIL 10PM. YOU'LL ALSO GET 1 FREE TICKET FOR OUR GIFTCARD & PRIZES RAFFLE.


Free Parking Til 10pm. "Mention Meetup" If Attendant Is Present. Might Be a Fee After 10pm, Will Confirm As Date Approaches.

Dress Code Is Business Casual, It's An Upscale Place: Nice Jeans Ok And Nice Shoes. Avoid Baggy Clothing & Work Boots.

results.description:
Note New time!!! Same Day of the month and location. Meet and Greet your weekend to decompress from the week!

Start your healing process too. This time we will have the opportunity to also incorporate Trifinity8 technology into our meditation. My client and friend Eugene Voll will help us deepen the meditation  with a healing frequency...running in the background ( Optional for anyone attending!)

We did it last month. 12 of us were there and it was wonderful. Many of the people attending this meet up are also my clients so you don't see that they are coming but boy oh boy if there ia any place on Earth worth being...it is here with these awesome people. Please bring a yoga mat (chair pad if you want to sit in the chairs provided)...and for the floor a blanket and pillow.

I'm really looking forward to spending a beautiful time of meditation with each of you!

results.description:
WOW! Friday Night Blues was ROARING last week! We had so many great people come out, both experienced and new. Let's keep the trend going with our Friday the 13th party!

If you're superstitious, you might think that Friday the 13th is bad luck. But we believe that you can make your own luck: being out on a Friday night, with your friends, and dancing... it's a recipe for GOOD luck! Arm yourself with four leaf clovers, rabbits feet, horseshoes, your lucky dance shoes... anything you need to prove that a little superstition is no match for us dancers. So let's get a resounding "HECK YES!!" and bring the good luck to Stepping Out this week!

The Intermediate series for the month of November is called "BulletproofYour Dancing." This week, we'll be learning about "Posture and Grounding":

Proper posture and grounding are essential to the blues aesthetic. Come explore the intricate details of these fundamental concepts, and learn how they can transform your dance!

Stepping Out Studios is a beautiful space on the 9th floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the key pad to the right of the building entrance.

****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson w/ George

8:30pm-9:30pm - Intermediate Lesson w/ Laura

9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance


****************************************************************************

Before you come in, it’s a great idea to take a look at this Etiquette Document that our community has compiled: http://bluesdancenewyork.com/etiquette

****************************************************************************

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12. But if you pay for both at the same time, it's just $20 for the night!

If you volunteer, your admission to the dance is free for the night. Email [masked] if you want to be added to the list.

Bring dance shoes with slippery soles (for easy turning), or socks, especially when wet outside.

All ages. No bar, but it is BYOB. Water is provided.

There is no dress code, but hygiene is important and dressing up a bit is a nice thing to do. Prioritize comfort and ability to move!

****************************************************************************

CLASS DESCRIPTIONS:

Fundamentals (8:30pm-9:30pm):

Fundamentals classes are for students new to blues dance and experienced students looking to hone their blues dance fundamentals. We cover how to connect with the music, how to connect with a partner, and have a rotating set of material to introduce students to important concepts in blues partner dance. These classes will give you everything you need to know to have a successful dance, and whet your appetite for more!


Intermediate (8:30pm-9:30pm**):

Intermediate series are technique-based classes designed to build specific knowledge and skills in students with prior blues dance experience. Intermediate classes are aimed to expand your knowledge depth in a specific topic of blues vocabulary through body awareness and historical context. Ultimately, taking class is your vehicle to having even more fun on the dance floor!

**Please plan to arrive on time. After 15 minutes have passed, students are no longer allowed to enter class.

results.description:
Join us for 'Fashion Disaster' Drawing at The National Arts Club! 

This session is open to sketchers of all levels from beginners to pros!

We will have two models to draw from. Watercolor and (non smelly) markers are welcome. 

This is a great chance to meet others in our group, hang out in an amazing environment (see below), listen to a wonderful DJ and of course create great work! There will also be a bar where you can buy a drink.

We will drawing in the Grand Gallery at The National Arts club one of the most historic and iconic arts buildings in New York City. (the room seen here.)

Bring your own drawing supplies, (no paint or sprays please.)


If you have any questions please feel free to email me. 


Thank you.

Simon

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:30p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON Your Sex Life and Relationships

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? 

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!
